1.name: Bulbasaur
1.description: While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are stored in the seed on its back in order to grow.

2.name: Ivysaur
2.description: Exposure to sunlight adds to its strength. Sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger.

3.name: Venusaur
3.description: Huge amounts of pollen burst from it with the force of a volcanic eruption. Breathing in too much of the pollen can cause fainting.

4.name: Charmander
4.description: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

5.name: Charmeleon
5.description: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.

6.name: Charizard
6.description: The flame inside its body burns hotter than 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit. When Charizard roars, that temperature climbs even higher.

7.name: Squirtle
7.description: When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.

8.name: Wartortle
8.description: It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to maintain its balance while swimming.

9.name: Blastoise
9.description: Water fired from this Pokémon’s central main cannon has enough power to blast a hole into a mountain.

10.name: Caterpie
10.description: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

11.name: Metapod
11.description: Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell, the body inside is tender. It can’t withstand a harsh attack.

12.name: Butterfree
12.description: Once it has opponents trapped in a tornado that could blow away a 10-ton truck, it finishes them off with its poisonous scales.

13.name: Weedle
13.description: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.

14.name: Kakuna
14.description: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.

15.name: Beedrill
15.description: Its legs have become poison stingers. It stabs its prey repeatedly with the stingers on its limbs, dealing the final blow with the stinger on its rear.

16.name: Pidgey
16.description: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.

17.name: Pidgeotto
17.description: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.

18.name: Pidgeot
18.description: With its muscular strength now greatly increased, it can fly continuously for two weeks without resting.

19.name: Rattata
19.description: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.

20.name: Raticate
20.description: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.

21.name: Spearow
21.description: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.

22.name: Fearow
22.description: A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.

23.name: Ekans
23.description: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

24.name: Arbok
24.description: The frightening patterns on its belly have been studied. Six variations have been confirmed.

25.name: Pikachu
25.description: When it smashes its opponents with its bolt- shaped tail, it delivers a surge of electricity equivalent to a lightning strike.

26.name: Raichu
26.description: This Pokémon rides on its tail while it uses its psychic powers to levitate. It attacks with star-shaped thunderbolts.

27.name: Sandshrew
27.description: It lives in snowy mountains on southern islands. When a blizzard rolls in, this Pokémon hunkers down in the snow to avoid getting blown away.

28.name: Sandslash
28.description: Many people climb snowy mountains, hoping to see the icy spikes of these Pokémon glistening in the light of dawn.

29.name: Nidoran♀
29.description: A mild-mannered Pokémon that does not like to fight. Beware—its small horn secretes venom.

30.name: Nidorina
30.description: When resting deep in its burrow, its barbs always retract. This is proof that it is relaxed.

31.name: Nidoqueen
31.description: Tough scales cover the sturdy body of this Pokémon. It appears that the scales grow in cycles.

32.name: Nidoran♂
32.description: Its large ears are always kept upright. If it senses danger, it will attack with a poisonous sting.

33.name: Nidorino
33.description: Its horn contains venom. If it stabs an enemy with the horn, the impact makes the poison leak out.

34.name: Nidoking
34.description: Its steel-like hide adds to its powerful tackle. Its horns are so hard, they can pierce a diamond.

35.name: Clefairy
35.description: Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.

36.name: Clefable
36.description: Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin drop from over a mile away, so they’re usually found in quiet places.

37.name: Vulpix
37.description: If you observe its curly hairs through a microscope, you’ll see small ice particles springing up.

38.name: Ninetales
38.description: While it will guide travelers who get lost on a snowy mountain down to the mountain’s base, it won’t forgive anyone who harms nature.

39.name: Jigglypuff
39.description: By freely changing the wavelength of its voice, Jigglypuff sings a mysterious melody sure to make any listener sleepy.

40.name: Wigglytuff
40.description: It’s proud of its fur, which is fine and delicate. In particular, the curl on its forehead has a texture that’s perfectly heavenly.

41.name: Zubat
41.description: Emits ultrasonic cries while it flies. They act as a sonar used to check for objects in its way.

42.name: Golbat
42.description: It attacks in a stealthy manner, without warning. Its sharp fangs are used to bite and to suck blood.

43.name: Oddish
43.description: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

44.name: Gloom
44.description: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

45.name: Vileplume
45.description: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

46.name: Paras
46.description: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.

47.name: Parasect
47.description: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushroom on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.

48.name: Venonat
48.description: Its large eyes act as radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.

49.name: Venomoth
49.description: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.

50.name: Diglett
50.description: Its three hairs change shape depending on Diglett’s mood. They’re a useful communication tool among these Pokémon.

51.name: Dugtrio
51.description: These Diglett triplets dig over 60 miles below sea level. No one knows what it’s like underground.

52.name: Meowth
52.description: These daring Pokémon have coins on their foreheads. Darker coins are harder, and harder coins garner more respect among Meowth.

53.name: Persian
53.description: This Pokémon is one tough opponent. Not only does it have formidable physical abilities, but it’s also not above fighting dirty.

54.name: Psyduck
54.description: As Psyduck gets stressed out, its headache gets progressively worse. It uses intense psychic energy to overwhelm those around it.

55.name: Golduck
55.description: Old tales tell of Golduck punishing those that defiled its river. The guilty were dragged into the water and taken away.

56.name: Mankey
56.description: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.

57.name: Primeape
57.description: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.

58.name: Growlithe
58.description: Extremely loyal, it will fearlessly bark at any opponent to protect its own Trainer from harm.

59.name: Arcanine
59.description: A Pokémon that has long been admired for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.

60.name: Poliwag
60.description: In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will cling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act like a suction cup.

61.name: Poliwhirl
61.description: This Pokémon’s sweat is a slimy mucus. When captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies’ grasp and escape.

62.name: Poliwrath
62.description: Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out powerful punches.

63.name: Abra
63.description: Abra can teleport in its sleep. Apparently the more deeply Abra sleeps, the farther its teleportations go.

64.name: Kadabra
64.description: This Pokémon’s telekinesis is immensely powerful. To prepare for evolution, Kadabra stores up psychic energy in the star on its forehead.

65.name: Alakazam
65.description: Alakazam wields potent psychic powers. It’s said that this Pokémon used these powers to create the spoons it holds.

66.name: Machop
66.description: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.

67.name: Machoke
67.description: Its formidable body never gets tired. It helps people by doing work such as the moving of heavy goods.

68.name: Machamp
68.description: With four arms that react more quickly than it can think, it can execute many punches at once.

69.name: Bellsprout
69.description: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.

70.name: Weepinbell
70.description: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.

71.name: Victreebel
71.description: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.

72.name: Tentacool
72.description: This Pokémon is mostly made of water. A Tentacool out in the ocean is very hard to spot, because its body blends in with the sea.

73.name: Tentacruel
73.description: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and shrink freely. Tentacruel ensnares prey in a net of spread-out tentacles, delivering venomous stings to its catch.

74.name: Geodude
74.description: Its stone head is imbued with electricity and magnetism. If you carelessly step on one, you’ll be in for a painful shock.

75.name: Graveler
75.description: When it comes rolling down a mountain path, anything in its way gets zapped by electricity and sent flying.

76.name: Golem
76.description: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it’s exposed to air.

77.name: Ponyta
77.description: This Pokémon will look into your eyes and read the contents of your heart. If it finds evil there, it promptly hides away.

78.name: Rapidash
78.description: The fastest runner becomes the leader, and it decides the herd’s pace and direction of travel.

79.name: Slowpoke
79.description: When this Pokémon’s tail is soaked in water, sweetness seeps from it. Slowpoke uses this trait to lure in and fish up other Pokémon.

80.name: Slowbro
80.description: Slowpoke became Slowbro when a Shellder bit on to its tail. Sweet flavors seeping from the tail make the Shellder feel as if its life is a dream.

81.name: Magnemite
81.description: It subsists on electricity. As Magnemite flies, it emits electromagnetic waves from the units on each side of its body.

82.name: Magneton
82.description: This Pokémon is constantly putting out a powerful magnetic force. Most computers go haywire when a Magneton approaches.

83.name: Farfetch’d
83.description: They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all of them use it in the same way. Several distinct styles of stalk fighting have been observed.

84.name: Doduo
84.description: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.

85.name: Dodrio
85.description: One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.

86.name: Seel
86.description: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.

87.name: Dewgong
87.description: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.

88.name: Grimer
88.description: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won’t grow in its path.

89.name: Muk
89.description: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.

90.name: Shellder
90.description: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

91.name: Cloyster
91.description: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength.

92.name: Gastly
92.description: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.

93.name: Haunter
93.description: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.

94.name: Gengar
94.description: It lays traps, hoping to steal the lives of those it catches. If you stand in front of its mouth, you’ll hear your loved ones’ voices calling out to you.

95.name: Onix
95.description: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.

96.name: Drowzee
96.description: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.

97.name: Hypno
97.description: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.

98.name: Krabby
98.description: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.

99.name: Kingler
99.description: The bubbles it spews out are strongly alkaline. Any opponents hit by them will have their bodies quickly melted away.

100.name: Voltorb
100.description: It is said to camouflage itself as a Poké Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.

101.name: Electrode
101.description: Stores electrical energy inside its body. Even the slightest shock could trigger a huge explosion.

102.name: Exeggcute
102.description: These Pokémon get nervous when they’re not in a group of six. The minute even one member of the group goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.

103.name: Exeggutor
103.description: When they work together, Exeggutor’s three heads can put out powerful psychic energy. Cloudy days make this Pokémon sluggish.

104.name: Cubone
104.description: This Pokémon wears the skull of its deceased mother. Sometimes Cubone’s dreams make it cry, but each tear Cubone sheds makes it stronger.

105.name: Marowak
105.description: When this Pokémon evolved, the skull of its mother fused to it. Marowak’s temperament also turned vicious at the same time.

106.name: Hitmonlee
106.description: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.

107.name: Hitmonchan
107.description: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

108.name: Lickitung
108.description: Bug Pokémon are Lickitung’s main food source. This Pokémon paralyzes its prey with a lick from its long tongue, then swallows the prey whole.

109.name: Koffing
109.description: It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing used to be more plentiful in the Galar region than they are now.

110.name: Weezing
110.description: Long ago, during a time when droves of factories fouled the air with pollution, Weezing changed into this form for some reason.

111.name: Rhyhorn
111.description: It can remember only one thing at a time. Once it starts rushing, it forgets why it started.

112.name: Rhydon
112.description: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

113.name: Chansey
113.description: This species was once very slow. To protect their eggs from other creatures, these Pokémon became able to flee quickly.

114.name: Tangela
114.description: The vines of a Tangela have a distinct scent. In some parts of Galar, Tangela vines are used as herbs.

115.name: Kangaskhan
115.description: There are records of a lost human child being raised by a childless Kangaskhan.

116.name: Horsea
116.description: They swim with dance-like motions and cause whirlpools to form. Horsea compete to see which of them can generate the biggest whirlpool.

117.name: Seadra
117.description: Seadra’s mouth is slender, but its suction power is strong. In an instant, Seadra can suck in food that’s larger than the opening of its mouth.

118.name: Goldeen
118.description: Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed like muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.

119.name: Seaking
119.description: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.

120.name: Staryu
120.description: Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn’t bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even if part of it is completely torn off.

121.name: Starmie
121.description: Starmie swims by spinning its body at high speed. As this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it absorbs tiny plankton.

122.name: Mr. Mime
122.description: It’s known for its top-notch pantomime skills. It protects itself from all sorts of attacks by emitting auras from its fingers to create walls.

123.name: Scyther
123.description: If you come across an area in a forest where a lot of the trees have been cut down, what you’ve found is a Scyther’s territory.

124.name: Jynx
124.description: Appears to move to a rhythm of its own, as if it were dancing. It wiggles its hips as it walks.

125.name: Electabuzz
125.description: If a major power outage occurs, it is certain that this Pokémon has eaten electricity at a power plant.

126.name: Magmar
126.description: Born in an active volcano. Its body is always cloaked in flames, so it looks like a big ball of fire.

127.name: Pinsir
127.description: This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey and then either splits the prey in half or flings it away.

128.name: Tauros
128.description: The Tauros of the Galar region are volatile in nature, and they won’t allow people to ride on their backs.

129.name: Magikarp
129.description: This weak and pathetic Pokémon gets easily pushed along rivers when there are strong currents.

130.name: Gyarados
130.description: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.

131.name: Lapras
131.description: It surrounds itself with a huge ring of gathered ice particles. It uses the ring to smash any icebergs that might impede its graceful swimming.

132.name: Ditto
132.description: When it encounters another Ditto, it will move faster than normal to duplicate that opponent exactly.

133.name: Eevee
133.description: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.

134.name: Vaporeon
134.description: Its body’s cellular structure is similar to the molecular composition of water. It can melt invisibly in water.

135.name: Jolteon
135.description: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.

136.name: Flareon
136.description: It stores some of the air it inhales in its internal flame pouch, which heats it to over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

137.name: Porygon
137.description: In recent years, this species has been very helpful in cyberspace. These Pokémon will go around checking to make sure no suspicious data exists.

138.name: Omanyte
138.description: An ancient Pokémon that was recovered from a fossil. It swam by cleverly twisting its 10 tentacles about.

139.name: Omastar
139.description: Its sharp beak rings its mouth. Its shell was too big for it to move freely, so it became extinct.

140.name: Kabuto
140.description: A Pokémon that was recovered from a fossil. It used the eyes on its back while hiding on the seafloor.

141.name: Kabutops
141.description: A slim and fast swimmer. It sliced its prey with its sharp sickles and drank the body fluids.

142.name: Aerodactyl
142.description: The power of Mega Evolution has completely restored its genes. The rocks on its body are harder than diamond.

143.name: Snorlax
143.description: This Pokémon’s stomach is so strong, even eating moldy or rotten food will not affect it.

144.name: Articuno
144.description: A legendary bird Pokémon. It freezes water that is contained in winter air and makes it snow.

145.name: Zapdos
145.description: This legendary bird Pokémon is said to appear when the sky turns dark and lightning showers down.

146.name: Moltres
146.description: A legendary bird Pokémon. As it flaps its flaming wings, even the night sky will turn red.

147.name: Dratini
147.description: Long thought to be a myth, this Pokémon’s existence was only recently confirmed by a fisherman who caught one.

148.name: Dragonair
148.description: According to a witness, its body was surrounded by a strange aura that gave it a mystical look.

149.name: Dragonite
149.description: It is said that this Pokémon lives somewhere in the sea and that it flies. However, these are only rumors.

150.name: Mewtwo
150.description: Psychic power has augmented its muscles. It has a grip strength of one ton and can sprint a hundred meters in two seconds flat!

151.name: Mew
151.description: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.

152.name: Chikorita
152.description: In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.

153.name: Bayleef
153.description: Bayleef’s neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each tubular leaf is a small shoot of a tree. The fragrance of this shoot makes people peppy.

154.name: Meganium
154.description: The fragrance of Meganium’s flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, this Pokémon gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe’s fighting spirit.

155.name: Cyndaquil
155.description: Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokémon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.

156.name: Quilava
156.description: Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This Pokémon applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.

157.name: Typhlosion
157.description: Typhlosion obscures itself behind a shimmering heat haze that it creates using its intensely hot flames. This Pokémon creates blazing explosive blasts that burn everything to cinders.

158.name: Totodile
158.description: Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile’s jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.

159.name: Croconaw
159.description: Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.

160.name: Feraligatr
160.description: Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.

161.name: Sentret
161.description: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.

162.name: Furret
162.description: Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pokémon is very nimble and fleet.

163.name: Hoothoot
163.description: It begins to hoot at the same time every day. Some Trainers use them in place of clocks.

164.name: Noctowl
164.description: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.

165.name: Ledyba
165.description: These very cowardly Pokémon join together and use Reflect to protect their nest.

166.name: Ledian
166.description: It flies through the night sky, sprinkling sparkly dust. According to some, if that dust sticks to you, good things will happen to you.

167.name: Spinarak
167.description: Although the poison from its fangs isn’t that strong, it’s potent enough to weaken prey that gets caught in its web.

168.name: Ariados
168.description: It spews threads from its mouth to catch its prey. When night falls, it leaves its web to go hunt aggressively.

169.name: Crobat
169.description: It feeds on the blood of living people and Pokémon. If it can’t drink any blood for even a short while, it becomes weak and unable to fly.

170.name: Chinchou
170.description: On the dark ocean floor, its only means of communication is its constantly flashing lights.

171.name: Lanturn
171.description: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.

172.name: Pichu
172.description: The electric sacs in its cheeks are small. If even a little electricity leaks, it becomes shocked.

173.name: Cleffa
173.description: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

174.name: Igglybuff
174.description: Taking advantage of the softness of its body, Igglybuff moves as if bouncing. Its body turns a deep pink when its temperature rises.

175.name: Togepi
175.description: It is considered to be a symbol of good luck. Its shell is said to be filled with happiness.

176.name: Togetic
176.description: It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people. It can float in midair without moving its wings.

177.name: Natu
177.description: Because its wings aren’t yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.

178.name: Xatu
178.description: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun’s movement all day.

179.name: Mareep
179.description: Rubbing its fleece generates electricity. You’ll want to pet it because it’s cute, but if you use your bare hand, you’ll get a painful shock.

180.name: Flaaffy
180.description: It stores electricity in its fluffy fleece. If it stores up too much, it will start to go bald in those patches.

181.name: Ampharos
181.description: Its tail shines bright and strong. It has been prized since long ago as a beacon for sailors.

182.name: Bellossom
182.description: Bellossom gather at times and appear to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.

183.name: Marill
183.description: Even after Marill swims in a cold sea, its water- repellent fur dries almost as soon as Marill leaves the water. That’s why this Pokémon is never cold.

184.name: Azumarill
184.description: These Pokémon create air-filled bubbles. When Azurill play in rivers, Azumarill will cover them with these bubbles.

185.name: Sudowoodo
185.description: It disguises itself as a tree to avoid attack. It hates water, so it will disappear if it starts raining.

186.name: Politoed
186.description: The cry of a male is louder than that of a female. Male Politoed with deep, menacing voices find more popularity with the opposite gender.

187.name: Hoppip
187.description: This Pokémon drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the approach of strong winds, Hoppip links its leaves with other Hoppip to prepare against being blown away.

188.name: Skiploom
188.description: Skiploom’s flower blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees Fahrenheit. How much the flower opens depends on the temperature. For that reason, this Pokémon is sometimes used as a thermometer.

189.name: Jumpluff
189.description: Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The Pokémon descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.

190.name: Aipom
190.description: It searches for prey from the tops of trees. When it spots its favorite food, Bounsweet, Aipom gets excited and pounces.

191.name: Sunkern
191.description: Sunkern tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so because it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its body for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on morning dew.

192.name: Sunflora
192.description: Sunflora converts solar energy into nutrition. It moves around actively in the daytime when it is warm. It stops moving as soon as the sun goes down for the night.

193.name: Yanma
193.description: Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This Pokémon uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.

194.name: Wooper
194.description: When walking on land, it covers its body with a poisonous film that keeps its skin from dehydrating.

195.name: Quagsire
195.description: Its body is always slimy. It often bangs its head on the river bottom as it swims but seems not to care.

196.name: Espeon
196.description: It unleashes psychic power from the orb on its forehead. When its power is exhausted, the orb grows dull and dark.

197.name: Umbreon
197.description: On the night of a full moon, or when it gets excited, the ring patterns on its body glow yellow.

198.name: Murkrow
198.description: It searches for shiny things for its boss. Murkrow’s presence is said to be unlucky, so many people detest it.

199.name: Slowking
199.description: Slowking can solve any problem presented to it, but no one can understand a thing Slowking says.

200.name: Misdreavus
200.description: What makes it happy is imitating the voices of weeping people and scaring everyone. It doesn’t deal well with folks who aren’t easily frightened.

201.name: Unown
201.description: This Pokémon is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown. Research into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.

202.name: Wobbuffet
202.description: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.

203.name: Girafarig
203.description: Girafarig’s rear head contains a tiny brain that is too small for thinking. However, the rear head doesn’t need to sleep, so it can keep watch over its surroundings 24 hours a day.

204.name: Pineco
204.description: It sticks tree bark to itself with its saliva, making itself thicker and larger. Elderly Pineco are ridiculously huge.

205.name: Forretress
205.description: In the moment that it gulps down its prey, the inside of its shell is exposed, but to this day, no one has ever seen that sight.

206.name: Dunsparce
206.description: The nests Dunsparce live in are mazes of tunnels. They never get lost in their own nests—they can tell where they are by the scent of the dirt.

207.name: Gligar
207.description: Gligar glides through the air without a sound as if it were sliding. This Pokémon hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then injects the prey with its poison barb.

208.name: Steelix
208.description: It is thought its body transformed as a result of iron accumulating internally from swallowing soil.

209.name: Snubbull
209.description: In contrast to its appearance, it’s quite timid. When playing with other puppy Pokémon, it sometimes gets bullied.

210.name: Granbull
210.description: Although it’s popular with young people, Granbull is timid and sensitive, so it’s totally incompetent as a watchdog.

211.name: Qwilfish
211.description: The small spikes covering its body developed from scales. They inject a toxin that causes fainting.

212.name: Scizor
212.description: Though its body is slim, Scizor has tremendous attacking power. Even Scizor’s muscles are made of metal.

213.name: Shuckle
213.description: The berries stored in its vaselike shell eventually become a thick, pulpy juice.

214.name: Heracross
214.description: This Pokémon takes pride in its strength, which allows it to lift things 100 times heavier than itself with no trouble at all.

215.name: Sneasel
215.description: It has a cunning yet savage disposition. It waits for parents to leave their nests, and then it sneaks in to steal their eggs.

216.name: Teddiursa
216.description: This Pokémon likes to lick its palms that are sweetened by being soaked in honey. Teddiursa concocts its own honey by blending fruits and pollen collected by Beedrill.

217.name: Ursaring
217.description: In the forests inhabited by Ursaring, it is said that there are many streams and towering trees where they gather food. This Pokémon walks through its forest gathering food every day.

218.name: Slugma
218.description: Slugma does not have any blood in its body. Instead, intensely hot magma circulates throughout this Pokémon’s body, carrying essential nutrients and oxygen to its organs.

219.name: Magcargo
219.description: Magcargo’s body temperature is approximately 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit. Water is vaporized on contact. If this Pokémon is caught in the rain, the raindrops instantly turn into steam, cloaking the area in a thick fog.

220.name: Swinub
220.description: If it smells something enticing, it dashes off headlong to find the source of the aroma.

221.name: Piloswine
221.description: Although its legs are short, its rugged hooves prevent it from slipping, even on icy ground.

222.name: Corsola
222.description: These Pokémon live in warm seas. In prehistoric times, many lived in the oceans around the Galar region as well.

223.name: Remoraid
223.description: Using its dorsal fin as a suction pad, it clings to a Mantine’s underside to scavenge for leftovers.

224.name: Octillery
224.description: It traps enemies with its suction-cupped tentacles, then smashes them with its rock-hard head.

225.name: Delibird
225.description: It has a generous habit of sharing its food with people and Pokémon, so it’s always scrounging around for more food.

226.name: Mantine
226.description: As it majestically swims, it doesn’t care if Remoraid attach to it to scavenge for its leftovers.

227.name: Skarmory
227.description: People fashion swords from Skarmory’s shed feathers, so this Pokémon is a popular element in heraldic designs.

228.name: Houndour
228.description: They make repeated eerie howls before dawn to call attention to their pack.

229.name: Houndoom
229.description: Identifiable by its eerie howls, people a long time ago thought it was the grim reaper and feared it.

230.name: Kingdra
230.description: Scales shed by this Pokémon have such a splendorous gleam to them that they’ve been given to royalty as gifts.

231.name: Phanpy
231.description: Phanpy uses its long nose to shower itself. When others gather around, they thoroughly douse each other with water. These Pokémon can be seen drying their soaking-wet bodies at the edge of water.

232.name: Donphan
232.description: If Donphan were to tackle with its hard body, even a house could be destroyed. Using its massive strength, the Pokémon helps clear rock and mud slides that block mountain trails.

233.name: Porygon2
233.description: After artificial intelligence was implemented in Porygon2, the Pokémon began using a strange language that only other Porygon2 understand.

234.name: Stantler
234.description: Stantler’s magnificent antlers were traded at high prices as works of art. As a result, this Pokémon was hunted close to extinction by those who were after the priceless antlers.

235.name: Smeargle
235.description: It draws symbols with the fluid that oozes from the tip of its tail. Depending on the symbol, Smeargle fanatics will pay big money for them.

236.name: Tyrogue
236.description: Even though it is small, it can’t be ignored because it will slug any handy target without warning.

237.name: Hitmontop
237.description: After doing a handstand to throw off the opponent’s timing, it presents its fancy kick moves.

238.name: Smoochum
238.description: Highly perceptive sensors, Smoochum’s lips are kept moist by its daily application of tree sap.

239.name: Elekid
239.description: When its horns shine a bluish white, that’s the sign it’s fully charged. You’ll get a shocking jolt if you touch it!

240.name: Magby
240.description: Its body temperature is always around 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit. If Magby falls into a small- enough pond, the whole thing will dry up.

241.name: Miltank
241.description: This Pokémon needs to be milked every day, or else it will fall ill. The flavor of Miltank milk changes with the seasons.

242.name: Blissey
242.description: Blissey lays mysterious eggs that are filled with happiness. It’s said that anyone who eats a Blissey egg will start acting kindly to all others.

243.name: Raikou
243.description: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokémon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.

244.name: Entei
244.description: Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokémon is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.

245.name: Suicune
245.description: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémon has the power to purify dirty water.

246.name: Larvitar
246.description: It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large mountain, it will fall asleep so it can grow.

247.name: Pupitar
247.description: It will not stay still, even while it’s a pupa. It already has arms and legs under its solid shell.

248.name: Tyranitar
248.description: The quakes caused when it walks make even great mountains crumble and change the surrounding terrain.

249.name: Lugia
249.description: Lugia’s wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this Pokémon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.

250.name: Ho-Oh
250.description: Ho-Oh’s feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokémon is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.

251.name: Celebi
251.description: This Pokémon traveled through time to come from the future. It bolsters grass and trees with its own strength, and it can heal wounds, too.

252.name: Treecko
252.description: Treecko is cool, calm, and collected—it never panics under any situation. If a bigger foe were to glare at this Pokémon, it would glare right back without conceding an inch of ground.

253.name: Grovyle
253.description: This Pokémon adeptly flies from branch to branch in trees. In a forest, no Pokémon can ever hope to catch a fleeing Grovyle however fast they may be.

254.name: Sceptile
254.description: Sceptile has seeds growing on its back. They are said to be bursting with nutrients that revitalize trees. This Pokémon raises the trees in a forest with loving care.

255.name: Torchic
255.description: Torchic has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug—it will be glowing with warmth. This Pokémon is covered all over by a fluffy coat of down.

256.name: Combusken
256.description: Combusken battles with the intensely hot flames it spews from its beak and with outstandingly destructive kicks. This Pokémon’s cry is very loud and distracting.

257.name: Blaziken
257.description: Blaziken has incredibly strong legs—it can easily clear a 30-story building in one leap. This Pokémon’s blazing punches leave its foes scorched and blackened.

258.name: Mudkip
258.description: In water, Mudkip breathes using the gills on its cheeks. If it is faced with a tight situation in battle, this Pokémon will unleash its amazing power—it can crush rocks bigger than itself.

259.name: Marshtomp
259.description: Marshtomp is much faster at traveling through mud than it is at swimming. This Pokémon’s hindquarters exhibit obvious development, giving it the ability to walk on just its hind legs.

260.name: Swampert
260.description: Swampert predicts storms by sensing subtle differences in the sounds of waves and tidal winds with its fins. If a storm is approaching, it piles up boulders to protect itself.

261.name: Poochyena
261.description: Poochyena is an omnivore—it will eat anything. A distinguishing feature is how large its fangs are compared to its body. This Pokémon tries to intimidate its foes by making the hair on its tail bristle out.

262.name: Mightyena
262.description: Mightyena travel and act as a pack in the wild. The memory of its life in the wild compels the Pokémon to obey only those Trainers that it recognizes to possess superior skill.

263.name: Zigzagoon
263.description: Zigzagoon that adapted to regions outside Galar acquired this appearance. If you’ve lost something, this Pokémon can likely find it.

264.name: Linoone
264.description: This very aggressive Pokémon will recklessly challenge opponents stronger than itself.

265.name: Wurmple
265.description: Wurmple is targeted by Swellow as prey. This Pokémon will try to resist by pointing the spikes on its rear at the attacking predator. It will weaken the foe by leaking poison from the spikes.

266.name: Silcoon
266.description: Silcoon was thought to endure hunger and not consume anything before its evolution. However, it is now thought that this Pokémon slakes its thirst by drinking rainwater that collects on its silk.

267.name: Beautifly
267.description: Beautifly has a long mouth like a coiled needle, which is very convenient for collecting pollen from flowers. This Pokémon rides the spring winds as it flits around gathering pollen.

268.name: Cascoon
268.description: If it is attacked, Cascoon remains motionless however badly it may be hurt. It does so because if it were to move, its body would be weak upon evolution. This Pokémon will also not forget the pain it endured.

269.name: Dustox
269.description: When Dustox flaps its wings, a fine dust is scattered all over. This dust is actually a powerful poison that will even make a pro wrestler sick. This Pokémon searches for food using its antennae like radar.

270.name: Lotad
270.description: Its leaf grew too large for it to live on land. That is how it began to live floating in the water.

271.name: Lombre
271.description: It lives at the water’s edge where it is sunny. It sleeps on a bed of water grass by day and becomes active at night.

272.name: Ludicolo
272.description: If it hears festive music, it begins moving in rhythm in order to amplify its power.

273.name: Seedot
273.description: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.

274.name: Nuzleaf
274.description: They live in holes bored in large trees. The sound of Nuzleaf’s grass flute fills listeners with dread.

275.name: Shiftry
275.description: It lives quietly in the deep forest. It is said to create chilly winter winds with the fans it holds.

276.name: Taillow
276.description: Taillow is young—it has only just left its nest. As a result, it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night. This Pokémon feeds on Wurmple that live in forests.

277.name: Swellow
277.description: Swellow is very conscientious about the upkeep of its glossy wings. Once two Swellow are gathered, they diligently take care of cleaning each other’s wings.

278.name: Wingull
278.description: It soars on updrafts without flapping its wings. It makes a nest on sheer cliffs at the sea’s edge.

279.name: Pelipper
279.description: Skimming the water’s surface, it dips its large bill in the sea, scoops up food and water, and carries it.

280.name: Ralts
280.description: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

281.name: Kirlia
281.description: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.

282.name: Gardevoir
282.description: To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic power to create a small black hole.

283.name: Surskit
283.description: It lives in ponds and marshes that feature lots of plant life. It often fights with Dewpider, whose habitat and diet are similar.

284.name: Masquerain
284.description: Its thin, winglike antennae are highly absorbent. It waits out rainy days in tree hollows.

285.name: Shroomish
285.description: If Shroomish senses danger, it shakes its body and scatters spores from the top of its head. This Pokémon’s spores are so toxic, they make trees and weeds wilt.

286.name: Breloom
286.description: The seeds ringing Breloom’s tail are made of hardened toxic spores. It is horrible to eat the seeds. Just taking a bite of this Pokémon’s seed will cause your stomach to rumble.

287.name: Slakoth
287.description: Slakoth’s heart beats just once a minute. Whatever happens, it is content to loaf around motionless. It is rare to see this Pokémon in motion.

288.name: Vigoroth
288.description: Vigoroth is simply incapable of remaining still. Even when it tries to sleep, the blood in its veins grows agitated, compelling this Pokémon to run wild throughout the jungle before it can settle down.

289.name: Slaking
289.description: Wherever Slaking live, rings of over a yard in diameter appear in grassy fields. They are made by the Pokémon as it eats all the grass within reach while lying prone on the ground.

290.name: Nincada
290.description: It can sometimes live underground for more than 10 years. It absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees.

291.name: Ninjask
291.description: This Pokémon is so quick, it is said to be able to avoid any attack. It loves to feed on tree sap.

292.name: Shedinja
292.description: A strange Pokémon—it flies without moving its wings, has a hollow shell for a body, and does not breathe.

293.name: Whismur
293.description: When Whismur cries, the sound of its own voice startles it, making the Pokémon cry even louder. It cries until it’s exhausted, then it falls asleep.

294.name: Loudred
294.description: The force of this Pokémon’s loud voice isn’t just the sound—it’s also the wave of air pressure that blows opponents away and damages them.

295.name: Exploud
295.description: This Pokémon can do more than just shout. To communicate with others of its kind, it’ll emit all sorts of sounds from the holes in its body.

296.name: Makuhita
296.description: There’s a rumor of a traditional recipe for stew that Trainers can use to raise strong Makuhita.

297.name: Hariyama
297.description: Hariyama that are big and fat aren’t necessarily strong. There are some small ones that move nimbly and use moves skillfully.

298.name: Azurill
298.description: Although Azurill are normally docile, an angry one will swing around the big ball on its tail and try to smash its opponents.

299.name: Nosepass
299.description: It hunts without twitching a muscle by pulling in its prey with powerful magnetism. But sometimes it pulls natural enemies in close.

300.name: Skitty
300.description: Skitty is known to chase around playfully after its own tail. In the wild, this Pokémon lives in holes in the trees of forests. It is very popular as a pet because of its adorable looks.

301.name: Delcatty
301.description: Delcatty sleeps anywhere it wants without keeping a permanent nest. If other Pokémon approach it as it sleeps, this Pokémon will never fight—it will just move away somewhere else.

302.name: Sableye
302.description: It feeds on gemstone crystals. In darkness, its eyes sparkle with the glitter of jewels.

303.name: Mawile
303.description: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.

304.name: Aron
304.description: Aron has a body of steel. With one all-out charge, this Pokémon can demolish even a heavy dump truck. The destroyed dump truck then becomes a handy meal for the Pokémon.

305.name: Lairon
305.description: Lairon feeds on iron contained in rocks and water. It makes its nest on mountains where iron ore is buried. As a result, the Pokémon often clashes with humans mining the iron ore.

306.name: Aggron
306.description: Aggron is protective of its environment. If its mountain is ravaged by a landslide or a fire, this Pokémon will haul topsoil to the area, plant trees, and beautifully restore its own territory.

307.name: Meditite
307.description: Meditite heightens its inner energy through meditation. It survives on just one berry a day. Minimal eating is another aspect of this Pokémon’s training.

308.name: Medicham
308.description: Through the power of meditation, Medicham developed its sixth sense. It gained the ability to use psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon is known to meditate for a whole month without eating.

309.name: Electrike
309.description: It stores electricity in its fur. It gives off sparks from all over its body in seasons when the air is dry.

310.name: Manectric
310.description: It rarely appears before people. It is said to nest where lightning has fallen.

311.name: Plusle
311.description: When Plusle is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric sparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this Pokémon cries loudly.

312.name: Minun
312.description: Minun loves to cheer on its partner in battle. It gives off sparks from its body while it is doing so. If its partner is in trouble, this Pokémon gives off increasing amounts of sparks.

313.name: Volbeat
313.description: Volbeat’s tail glows like a lightbulb. With other Volbeat, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This Pokémon loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.

314.name: Illumise
314.description: Illumise leads a flight of illuminated Volbeat to draw signs in the night sky. This Pokémon is said to earn greater respect from its peers by composing more complex designs in the sky.

315.name: Roselia
315.description: It uses the different poisons in each hand separately when it attacks. The stronger its aroma, the healthier it is.

316.name: Gulpin
316.description: Most of Gulpin’s body is made up of its stomach—its heart and brain are very small in comparison. This Pokémon’s stomach contains special enzymes that dissolve anything.

317.name: Swalot
317.description: Swalot has no teeth, so what it eats, it swallows whole, no matter what. Its cavernous mouth yawns widely. An automobile tire could easily fit inside this Pokémon’s mouth.

318.name: Carvanha
318.description: These Pokémon have sharp fangs and powerful jaws. Sailors avoid Carvanha dens at all costs.

319.name: Sharpedo
319.description: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sea. Any ship entering the waters Sharpedo calls home will be attacked—no exceptions.

320.name: Wailmer
320.description: When it sucks in a large volume of seawater, it becomes like a big, bouncy ball. It eats a ton of food daily.

321.name: Wailord
321.description: Its immense size is the reason for its popularity. Wailord watching is a favorite sightseeing activity in various parts of the world.

322.name: Numel
322.description: Numel stores magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit within its body. If it gets wet, the magma cools and hardens. In that event, the Pokémon’s body grows heavy and its movements become sluggish.

323.name: Camerupt
323.description: The humps on Camerupt’s back are formed by a transformation of its bones. They sometimes blast out molten magma. This Pokémon apparently erupts often when it is enraged.

324.name: Torkoal
324.description: You find abandoned coal mines full of them. They dig tirelessly in search of coal.

325.name: Spoink
325.description: Spoink keeps a pearl on top of its head. The pearl functions to amplify this Pokémon’s psychokinetic powers. It is therefore on a constant search for a bigger pearl.

326.name: Grumpig
326.description: Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to wield its fantastic powers. When it is doing so, it dances bizarrely. This Pokémon’s black pearls are valuable as works of art.

327.name: Spinda
327.description: Each Spinda’s spot pattern is different. With its stumbling movements, it evades opponents’ attacks brilliantly!

328.name: Trapinch
328.description: It makes an inescapable conical pit and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.

329.name: Vibrava
329.description: To help make its wings grow, it dissolves quantities of prey in its digestive juices and guzzles them down every day.

330.name: Flygon
330.description: It is nicknamed the Desert Spirit because the flapping of its wings sounds like a woman singing.

331.name: Cacnea
331.description: The more arid and harsh the environment, the more pretty and fragrant a flower Cacnea grows. This Pokémon battles by wildly swinging its thorny arms.

332.name: Cacturne
332.description: If a traveler is going through a desert in the thick of night, Cacturne will follow in a ragtag group. The Pokémon are biding their time, waiting for the traveler to tire and become incapable of moving.

333.name: Swablu
333.description: Swablu loves to make things clean. If it spots something dirty, it will wipe and polish it with its cottony wings. If its wings become dirty, this Pokémon finds a stream and showers itself.

334.name: Altaria
334.description: Altaria sings in a gorgeous soprano. Its wings are like cotton clouds. This Pokémon catches updrafts with its buoyant wings and soars way up into the wild blue yonder.

335.name: Zangoose
335.description: Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokémon shares a bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.

336.name: Seviper
336.description: Seviper’s swordlike tail serves two purposes—it slashes foes and douses them with secreted poison. This Pokémon will not give up its long-running blood feud with Zangoose.

337.name: Lunatone
337.description: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.

338.name: Solrock
338.description: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.

339.name: Barboach
339.description: It probes muddy riverbeds with its two long whiskers. A slimy film protects its body.

340.name: Whiscash
340.description: It claims a large swamp to itself. If a foe comes near it, it sets off tremors by thrashing around.

341.name: Corphish
341.description: It was originally a Pokémon from afar that escaped to the wild. It can adapt to the dirtiest river.

342.name: Crawdaunt
342.description: A brutish Pokémon that loves to battle. It will crash itself into any foe that approaches its nest.

343.name: Baltoy
343.description: It was discovered in ancient ruins. While moving, it constantly spins. It stands on one foot even when asleep.

344.name: Claydol
344.description: It appears to have been born from clay dolls made by ancient people. It uses telekinesis to float and move.

345.name: Lileep
345.description: It sticks to rocks with its powerful suckers and can’t be washed away no matter how rough the surf gets.

346.name: Cradily
346.description: This carnivorous Pokémon lived in primordial seas. It catches prey in its eight tentacles and dissolves them with digestive fluid as it eats.

347.name: Anorith
347.description: This is one kind of primeval bug Pokémon. With eight wings, it could apparently swim a lot faster than you’d expect.

348.name: Armaldo
348.description: Armaldo adapted from living in water to living on land. It has been determined that it is the ancestor of some bug Pokémon.

349.name: Feebas
349.description: It is a shabby and ugly Pokémon. However, it is very hardy and can survive on little water.

350.name: Milotic
350.description: It’s said that a glimpse of a Milotic and its beauty will calm any hostile emotions you’re feeling.

351.name: Castform
351.description: Its form changes depending on the weather. The rougher conditions get, the rougher Castform’s disposition!

352.name: Kecleon
352.description: Its color changes for concealment and also when its mood or health changes. The darker the color, the healthier it is.

353.name: Shuppet
353.description: There’s a proverb that says, “Shun the house where Shuppet gather in the growing dusk.”

354.name: Banette
354.description: Resentment at being cast off made it spring into being. Some say that treating it well will satisfy it, and it will once more become a stuffed toy.

355.name: Duskull
355.description: Making itself invisible, it silently sneaks up to prey. It has the ability to slip through thick walls.

356.name: Dusclops
356.description: It seeks drifting will-o’-the-wisps and sucks them into its empty body. What happens inside is a mystery.

357.name: Tropius
357.description: Bunches of delicious fruit grow around its neck. In warm areas, many ranches raise Tropius.

358.name: Chimecho
358.description: In high winds, Chimecho cries as it hangs from a tree branch or the eaves of a building using a suction cup on its head. This Pokémon plucks berries with its long tail and eats them.

359.name: Absol
359.description: The elderly call it the disaster Pokémon and detest it, but interest in its power to predict disasters is on the rise.

360.name: Wynaut
360.description: It tends to move in a pack with others. They cluster in a tight group to sleep in a cave.

361.name: Snorunt
361.description: It can only survive in cold areas. It bounces happily around, even in environments as cold as −150 degrees Fahrenheit.

362.name: Glalie
362.description: It can instantly freeze moisture in the atmosphere. It uses this power to freeze its foes.

363.name: Spheal
363.description: Spheal always travels by rolling around on its ball-like body. When the season for ice floes arrives, this Pokémon can be seen rolling about on ice and crossing the sea.

364.name: Sealeo
364.description: Sealeo often balances and rolls things on the tip of its nose. While the Pokémon is rolling something, it checks the object’s aroma and texture to determine whether it likes the object or not.

365.name: Walrein
365.description: Walrein swims all over in frigid seawater while crushing icebergs with its grand, imposing tusks. Its thick layer of blubber makes enemy attacks bounce off harmlessly.

366.name: Clamperl
366.description: Clamperl’s pearls are exceedingly precious. They can be more than 10 times as costly as Shellder’s pearls.

367.name: Huntail
367.description: Deep seas are their habitat. According to tradition, when Huntail wash up onshore, something unfortunate will happen.

368.name: Gorebyss
368.description: It sucks bodily fluids out of its prey. The leftover meat sinks to the seafloor, where it becomes food for other Pokémon.

369.name: Relicanth
369.description: The reason it hasn’t changed at all in a hundred million years is that it’s apparently already a perfect life-form.

370.name: Luvdisc
370.description: Luvdisc makes its home in coral reefs in warm seas. It especially likes sleeping in the space between Corsola’s branches.

371.name: Bagon
371.description: Some theories suggest that its behavior of forcefully bashing its head into things stimulates cells that affect its evolution.

372.name: Shelgon
372.description: Shelgon lives deep within caves. It stays shut up in its hard shell, dreaming of the day it will be able to fly.

373.name: Salamence
373.description: Thanks to its fervent wishes, the cells in its body finally mutated, and at last it has its heart’s desire—wings.

374.name: Beldum
374.description: If you anger it, it will do more than rampage. It will also burst out strong magnetism, causing nearby machines to break.

375.name: Metang
375.description: It flies at high speeds around the skies. When it finds its prey, Metang takes a firm grip with its sharp claws and never lets go.

376.name: Metagross
376.description: It analyzes its opponents with more accuracy than a supercomputer, which enables it to calmly back them into a corner.

377.name: Regirock
377.description: Regirock’s body is composed entirely of rocks. Recently, a study made the startling discovery that the rocks were all unearthed from different locations.

378.name: Regice
378.description: Regice cloaks itself with frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit. Things will freeze solid just by going near this Pokémon. Its icy body is so cold, it will not melt even if it is immersed in magma.

379.name: Registeel
379.description: Registeel was imprisoned by people in ancient times. The metal composing its body is thought to be a curious substance that is not of this earth.

380.name: Latias
380.description: Latias is highly intelligent and capable of understanding human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down. The Pokémon enfolds its body with its down and refracts light to alter its appearance.

381.name: Latios
381.description: Latios will only open its heart to a Trainer with a compassionate spirit. This Pokémon can fly faster than a jet plane by folding its forelegs to minimize air resistance.

382.name: Kyogre
382.description: Kyogre is said to be the personification of the sea itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Groudon, as each sought to gain the power of nature.

383.name: Groudon
383.description: Through Primal Reversion and with nature’s full power, it will take back its true form. It can cause magma to erupt and expand the landmass of the world.

384.name: Rayquaza
384.description: It flies forever through the ozone layer, consuming meteoroids for sustenance. The many meteoroids in its body provide the energy it needs to Mega Evolve.

385.name: Jirachi
385.description: It’s believed that when this Pokémon wakes from its 1,000-year slumber, it will grant any wishes written on the notes attached to its head.

386.name: Deoxys
386.description: Deoxys emerged from a virus that came from space. It is highly intelligent and wields psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon shoots lasers from the crystalline organ on its chest.

387.name: Turtwig
387.description: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.

388.name: Grotle
388.description: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.

389.name: Torterra
389.description: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.

390.name: Chimchar
390.description: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.

391.name: Monferno
391.description: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.

392.name: Infernape
392.description: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.

393.name: Piplup
393.description: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

394.name: Prinplup
394.description: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.

395.name: Empoleon
395.description: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.

396.name: Starly
396.description: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.

397.name: Staravia
397.description: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.

398.name: Staraptor
398.description: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.

399.name: Bidoof
399.description: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

400.name: Bibarel
400.description: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.

401.name: Kricketot
401.description: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

402.name: Kricketune
402.description: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.

403.name: Shinx
403.description: Electricity makes this Pokémon’s fur glow. Shinx sends signals to others of its kind by shaking the tip of its tail while the tail tip is shining brightly.

404.name: Luxio
404.description: Upon encountering an opponent, this Pokémon prepares for battle by extending its claws, which can put out 1,000,000 volts of electricity.

405.name: Luxray
405.description: Seeing through solid objects uses up a lot of Luxray’s electricity, so the Pokémon sleeps for long periods of time to store up energy.

406.name: Budew
406.description: This Pokémon is highly sensitive to temperature changes. When its bud starts to open, that means spring is right around the corner.

407.name: Roserade
407.description: The poison in its right hand is quick acting. The poison in its left hand is slow acting. Both are life threatening.

408.name: Cranidos
408.description: Its hard skull is its distinguishing feature. It snapped trees by headbutting them, and then it fed on their ripe berries.

409.name: Rampardos
409.description: This ancient Pokémon used headbutts skillfully. Its brain was really small, so some theories suggest that its stupidity led to its extinction.

410.name: Shieldon
410.description: Although its fossils can be found in layers of primeval rock, nothing but its face has ever been discovered.

411.name: Bastiodon
411.description: This Pokémon is from roughly 100 million years ago. Its terrifyingly tough face is harder than steel.

412.name: Burmy
412.description: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.

413.name: Wormadam
413.description: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.

414.name: Mothim
414.description: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the Combee hive.

415.name: Combee
415.description: It ceaselessly gathers nectar from sunrise to sundown, all for the sake of Vespiquen and the swarm.

416.name: Vespiquen
416.description: Vespiquen that give off more pheromones have larger swarms of Combee attendants.

417.name: Pachirisu
417.description: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

418.name: Buizel
418.description: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.

419.name: Floatzel
419.description: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.

420.name: Cherubi
420.description: The deeper a Cherubi’s red, the more nutrients it has stockpiled in its body. And the sweeter and tastier its small ball!

421.name: Cherrim
421.description: The faint scent that emanates from its full blossom entices bug Pokémon to it.

422.name: Shellos
422.description: Subjecting this Pokémon to a strong force causes it to secrete a strange purple fluid. Though harmless, the fluid is awfully sticky.

423.name: Gastrodon
423.description: The softness of its body helps disperse the force of impacts, so although its body is uncommonly squishy, it’s also surprisingly resilient.

424.name: Ambipom
424.description: It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both of its tails around you and gives you a squeeze, that’s proof it really likes you.

425.name: Drifloon
425.description: The gathering of many souls gave rise to this Pokémon. During humid seasons, they seem to appear in abundance.

426.name: Drifblim
426.description: It grabs people and Pokémon and carries them off somewhere. Where do they go? Nobody knows.

427.name: Buneary
427.description: Buneary can attack by rolling up their ears and then striking with the force created by unrolling them. This attack becomes stronger with training.

428.name: Lopunny
428.description: Once hot seasons are over, Lopunny’s coat will be replaced with fur that holds a lot of insulating air in preparation for colder weather.

429.name: Mismagius
429.description: Its muttered curses can cause awful headaches or terrifying visions that torment others.

430.name: Honchkrow
430.description: Its goons take care of most of the fighting for it. The only time it dirties its own hands is in delivering a final blow to finish off an opponent.

431.name: Glameow
431.description: When it’s happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.

432.name: Purugly
432.description: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.

433.name: Chingling
433.description: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.

434.name: Stunky
434.description: If it lifts its tail and points its rear at you, beware. It’s about to spray you with a fluid stinky enough to make you faint.

435.name: Skuntank
435.description: It digs holes in the ground to make its nest. The stench of the fluid it lets fly from the tip of its tail is extremely potent.

436.name: Bronzor
436.description: Polishing Bronzor to a shine makes its surface reflect the truth, according to common lore. Be that as it may, Bronzor hates being polished.

437.name: Bronzong
437.description: Many scientists suspect that this Pokémon originated outside the Galar region, based on the patterns on its body.

438.name: Bonsly
438.description: This Pokémon lives in dry, rocky areas. As its green spheres dry out, their dull luster increases.

439.name: Mime Jr.
439.description: It looks for a Mr. Rime that’s a good dancer and carefully copies the Mr. Rime’s steps like an apprentice.

440.name: Happiny
440.description: Happiny’s willing to lend its precious round stone to those it’s friendly with, but if the stone isn’t returned, Happiny will cry and throw a tantrum.

441.name: Chatot
441.description: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

442.name: Spiritomb
442.description: It was bound to a fissure in an odd keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.

443.name: Gible
443.description: Its original home is an area much hotter than Alola. If you’re planning to live with one, your heating bill will soar.

444.name: Gabite
444.description: It sheds its skin and gradually grows larger. Its scales can be ground into a powder and used as raw materials for traditional medicine.

445.name: Garchomp
445.description: Its fine scales don’t just reduce wind resistance—their sharp edges also cause injury to any opponent who attacks it.

446.name: Munchlax
446.description: It stores food beneath its fur. It might share just one bite, but only if it really trusts you.

447.name: Riolu
447.description: It can use waves called auras to gauge how others are feeling. These same waves can also tell this Pokémon about the state of the environment.

448.name: Lucario
448.description: It can tell what people are thinking. Only Trainers who have justice in their hearts can earn this Pokémon’s trust.

449.name: Hippopotas
449.description: This Pokémon is active during the day and passes the cold desert nights burrowed snugly into the sand.

450.name: Hippowdon
450.description: When roused to violence by its rage, it spews out the quantities of sand it has swallowed and whips up a sandstorm.

451.name: Skorupi
451.description: It attacks using the claws on its tail. Once locked in its grip, its prey is unable to move as this Pokémon’s poison seeps in.

452.name: Drapion
452.description: It’s so vicious that it’s called the Sand Demon. Yet when confronted by Hippowdon, Drapion keeps a low profile and will never pick a fight.

453.name: Croagunk
453.description: Once diluted, its poison becomes medicinal. This Pokémon came into popularity after a pharmaceutical company chose it as a mascot.

454.name: Toxicroak
454.description: It booms out a victory croak when its prey goes down in defeat. This Pokémon and Seismitoad are related species.

455.name: Carnivine
455.description: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

456.name: Finneon
456.description: It lures in prey with its shining tail fins. It stays near the surface during the day and moves to the depths when night falls.

457.name: Lumineon
457.description: They traverse the deep waters as if crawling over the seafloor. The fantastic lights of its fins shine like stars in the night sky.

458.name: Mantyke
458.description: It swims along with a school of Remoraid, and they’ll all fight together to repel attackers.

459.name: Snover
459.description: The berries that grow around its belly are like ice pops. Galarian Darumaka absolutely love these berries.

460.name: Abomasnow
460.description: This Pokémon is known to bring blizzards. A shake of its massive body is enough to cause whiteout conditions.

461.name: Weavile
461.description: With its claws, it leaves behind signs for its friends to find. The number of distinct signs is said to be over 500.

462.name: Magnezone
462.description: It’s thought that a special magnetic field changed the molecular structure of this Pokémon’s body, and that’s what caused the Pokémon’s evolution.

463.name: Lickilicky
463.description: Lickilicky can do just about anything with its tongue, which is as dexterous as the human hand. In contrast, Lickilicky’s use of its fingers is clumsy.

464.name: Rhyperior
464.description: It relies on its carapace to deflect incoming attacks and throw its enemy off balance. As soon as that happens, it drives its drill into the foe.

465.name: Tangrowth
465.description: Vine growth is accelerated for Tangrowth living in warm climates. If the vines grow long, Tangrowth shortens them by tearing parts of them off.

466.name: Electivire
466.description: A single Electivire can provide enough electricity for all the buildings in a big city for a year.

467.name: Magmortar
467.description: Magmortar takes down its enemies by shooting fireballs, which burn them to a blackened crisp. It avoids this method when hunting prey.

468.name: Togekiss
468.description: Known as a bringer of blessings, it’s been depicted on good-luck charms since ancient times.

469.name: Yanmega
469.description: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

470.name: Leafeon
470.description: This Pokémon’s tail is blade sharp, with a fantastic cutting edge that can slice right though large trees.

471.name: Glaceon
471.description: The coldness emanating from Glaceon causes powdery snow to form, making it quite a popular Pokémon at ski resorts.

472.name: Gliscor
472.description: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

473.name: Mamoswine
473.description: It looks strong, and that’s exactly what it is. As the weather grows colder, its ice tusks grow longer, thicker, and more impressive.

474.name: Porygon-Z
474.description: Some say an additional program made this Pokémon evolve, but even academics can’t agree on whether Porygon-Z is really an evolution.

475.name: Gallade
475.description: Sharply attuned to others’ wishes for help, this Pokémon seeks out those in need and aids them in battle.

476.name: Probopass
476.description: It uses three small units to catch prey and battle enemies. The main body mostly just gives orders.

477.name: Dusknoir
477.description: With the mouth on its belly, Dusknoir swallows its target whole. The soul is the only thing eaten— Dusknoir disgorges the body before departing.

478.name: Froslass
478.description: It spits out cold air of nearly −60 degrees Fahrenheit to freeze its quarry. It brings frozen prey back to its lair and neatly lines them up.

479.name: Rotom
479.description: With a body made of plasma, it can inhabit all sorts of machines. It loves to surprise others.

480.name: Uxie
480.description: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.

481.name: Mesprit
481.description: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake’s surface.

482.name: Azelf
482.description: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.

483.name: Dialga
483.description: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

484.name: Palkia
484.description: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

485.name: Heatran
485.description: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

486.name: Regigigas
486.description: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.

487.name: Giratina
487.description: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

488.name: Cresselia
488.description: Those who sleep holding Cresselia’s feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

489.name: Phione
489.description: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.

490.name: Manaphy
490.description: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.

491.name: Darkrai
491.description: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

492.name: Shaymin
492.description: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

493.name: Arceus
493.description: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.

494.name: Victini
494.description: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being’s entire body will be overflowing with power.

495.name: Snivy
495.description: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

496.name: Servine
496.description: When it gets dirty, its leaves can’t be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

497.name: Serperior
497.description: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

498.name: Tepig
498.description: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.

499.name: Pignite
499.description: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

500.name: Emboar
500.description: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.

501.name: Oshawott
501.description: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

502.name: Dewott
502.description: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.

503.name: Samurott
503.description: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

504.name: Patrat
504.description: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won’t notice a foe coming from behind.

505.name: Watchog
505.description: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

506.name: Lillipup
