506.description: This Pokémon is far brighter than the average child, and Lillipup won’t forget the love it receives or any abuse it suffers.

507.name: Herdier
507.description: The black fur that covers this Pokémon’s body is dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce right off.

508.name: Stoutland
508.description: Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive moustache. It’s said that moustache length is what determines social standing among this species.

509.name: Purrloin
509.description: Opponents that get drawn in by its adorable behavior come away with stinging scratches from its claws and stinging pride from its laughter.

510.name: Liepard
510.description: Don’t be fooled by its gorgeous fur and elegant figure. This is a moody and vicious Pokémon.

511.name: Pansage
511.description: It’s good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It’s kind enough to share them with friends.

512.name: Simisage
512.description: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

513.name: Pansear
513.description: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

514.name: Simisear
514.description: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

515.name: Panpour
515.description: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

516.name: Simipour
516.description: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

517.name: Munna
517.description: It eats dreams and releases mist. The mist is pink when it’s eating a good dream, and black when it’s eating a nightmare.

518.name: Musharna
518.description: It drowses and dreams all the time. It’s best to leave it be if it’s just woken up, as it’s a terrible grump when freshly roused from sleep.

519.name: Pidove
519.description: It’s forgetful and not very bright, but many Trainers love it anyway for its friendliness and sincerity.

520.name: Tranquill
520.description: These bright Pokémon have acute memories. Apparently delivery workers often choose them as their partners.

521.name: Unfezant
521.description: This Pokémon is intelligent and intensely proud. People will sit up and take notice if you become the Trainer of one.

522.name: Blitzle
522.description: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

523.name: Zebstrika
523.description: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

524.name: Roggenrola
524.description: When it detects a noise, it starts to move. The energy core inside it makes this Pokémon slightly warm to the touch.

525.name: Boldore
525.description: It relies on sound in order to monitor what’s in its vicinity. When angered, it will attack without ever changing the direction it’s facing.

526.name: Gigalith
526.description: Although its energy blasts can blow away a dump truck, they have a limitation— they can only be fired when the sun is out.

527.name: Woobat
527.description: It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about, searching for its prey—bug Pokémon.

528.name: Swoobat
528.description: The auspicious shape of this Pokémon’s nose apparently led some regions to consider Swoobat a symbol of good luck.

529.name: Drilbur
529.description: It’s a digger, using its claws to burrow through the ground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so many farmers have little love for it.

530.name: Excadrill
530.description: Known as the Drill King, this Pokémon can tunnel through the terrain at speeds of over 90 mph.

531.name: Audino
531.description: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

532.name: Timburr
532.description: Timburr that have started carrying logs that are about three times their size are nearly ready to evolve.

533.name: Gurdurr
533.description: Gurdurr excels at demolition—construction is not its forte. In any case, there’s skill in the way this Pokémon wields its metal beam.

534.name: Conkeldurr
534.description: When going all out, this Pokémon throws aside its concrete pillars and leaps at opponents to pummel them with its fists.

535.name: Tympole
535.description: It uses sound waves to communicate with others of its kind. People and other Pokémon species can’t hear its cries of warning.

536.name: Palpitoad
536.description: On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.

537.name: Seismitoad
537.description: This Pokémon is popular among the elderly, who say the vibrations of its lumps are great for massages.

538.name: Throh
538.description: They train in groups of five. Any member that can’t keep up will discard its belt and leave the group.

539.name: Sawk
539.description: The karate chops of a Sawk that’s trained itself to the limit can cleave the ocean itself.

540.name: Sewaddle
540.description: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.

541.name: Swadloon
541.description: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.

542.name: Leavanny
542.description: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.

543.name: Venipede
543.description: Its fangs are highly venomous. If this Pokémon finds prey it thinks it can eat, it leaps for them without any thought of how things might turn out.

544.name: Whirlipede
544.description: Whirlipede protects itself with a sturdy shell and poisonous spikes while it stores up the energy it’ll need for evolution.

545.name: Scolipede
545.description: Scolipede engage in fierce territorial battles with Centiskorch. At the end of one of these battles, the victor makes a meal of the loser.

546.name: Cottonee
546.description: Weaving together the cotton of both Cottonee and Eldegoss produces exquisite cloth that’s highly prized by many luxury brands.

547.name: Whimsicott
547.description: As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff builds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.

548.name: Petilil
548.description: The deeper the color of a Petilil’s leaves, the healthier the Pokémon is. Petilil sometimes makes its home in a well-tended field or flowerbed.

549.name: Lilligant
549.description: Essential oils made from Lilligant flowers have a sublime scent, but they’re also staggeringly expensive.

550.name: Basculin
550.description: Known for their violence, these Pokémon have the most fights with schools of red- striped Basculin.

551.name: Sandile
551.description: Sandile is small, but its legs and lower body are powerful. Pushing sand aside as it goes, Sandile moves through the desert as if it’s swimming.

552.name: Krokorok
552.description: Although this Pokémon has specialized eyes that allow it to see in the dark, Krokorok won’t move much at night—the desert gets cold after sunset.

553.name: Krookodile
553.description: While terribly aggressive, Krookodile also has the patience to stay hidden under sand for days, lying in wait for prey.

554.name: Darumaka
554.description: This popular symbol of good fortune will never fall over in its sleep, no matter how it’s pushed or pulled.

555.name: Darmanitan
555.description: When wounded, it stops moving. It goes as still as stone to meditate, sharpening its mind and spirit.

556.name: Maractus
556.description: Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds. They’re jam-packed with nutrients, making them a precious food source out in the desert.

557.name: Dwebble
557.description: It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.

558.name: Crustle
558.description: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They’re mighty enough to crack Rhyperior’s carapace.

559.name: Scraggy
559.description: It protects itself with its durable skin. It’s thought that this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has completely stretched out.

560.name: Scrafty
560.description: While mostly known for having the temperament of an aggressive ruffian, this Pokémon takes very good care of its family, friends, and territory.

561.name: Sigilyph
561.description: A discovery was made in the desert where Sigilyph fly. The ruins of what may have been an ancient city were found beneath the sands.

562.name: Yamask
562.description: The spirit of a person from a bygone age became this Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching for someone who knows its face.

563.name: Cofagrigus
563.description: There are many depictions of Cofagrigus decorating ancient tombs. They’re symbols of the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.

564.name: Tirtouga
564.description: Its hunting grounds encompassed a broad area, from the land to more than half a mile deep in the ocean.

565.name: Carracosta
565.description: Carracosta eats every last bit of the prey it catches, even the shells and bones, to further strengthen its sturdy shell.

566.name: Archen
566.description: Restored from a fossil, this ancient bird Pokémon has wings but can’t yet fly.

567.name: Archeops
567.description: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, the muscles it uses to flap its wings are still weak, so it needs a long runway in order to take off.

568.name: Trubbish
568.description: This Pokémon was born from a bag stuffed with trash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched by Trubbish.

569.name: Garbodor
569.description: The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm is so virulent that it can kill a weakened creature instantly.

570.name: Zorua
570.description: Zorua sometimes transforms into a person and goes into cities to search for food. When Zorua does this, it usually takes on the form of a child.

571.name: Zoroark
571.description: Seeking to ease the burden of their solitude, lonely Trainers tell Zoroark to show illusions to them.

572.name: Minccino
572.description: They pet each other with their tails as a form of greeting. Of the two, the one whose tail is fluffier is a bit more boastful.

573.name: Cinccino
573.description: A special oil that seeps through their fur helps them avoid attacks. The oil fetches a high price at market.

574.name: Gothita
574.description: Even when nobody seems to be around, Gothita can still be heard making a muted cry. Many believe it’s speaking to something only it can see.

575.name: Gothorita
575.description: On nights when the stars shine, this Pokémon’s psychic power is at its strongest. It’s unknown just what link Gothorita has to the greater universe.

576.name: Gothitelle
576.description: A criminal who was shown his fate by a Gothitelle went missing that same day and was never seen again.

577.name: Solosis
577.description: Many say that the special liquid covering this Pokémon’s body would allow it to survive in the vacuum of space.

578.name: Duosion
578.description: Its brain has split into two, and the two halves rarely think alike. Its actions are utterly unpredictable.

579.name: Reuniclus
579.description: It’s said that drinking the liquid surrounding Reuniclus grants wisdom. Problem is, the liquid is highly toxic to anything besides Reuniclus itself.

580.name: Ducklett
580.description: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

581.name: Swanna
581.description: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

582.name: Vanillite
582.description: Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an icicle. It spews out freezing air at −58 degrees Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.

583.name: Vanillish
583.description: It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it spares their lives afterward—it’s a kind Pokémon.

584.name: Vanilluxe
584.description: People believe this Pokémon formed when two Vanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is roughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.

585.name: Deerling
585.description: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

586.name: Sawsbuck
586.description: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.

587.name: Emolga
587.description: This Pokémon absolutely loves sweet berries. Sometimes it stuffs its cheeks full of so much food that it can’t fly properly.

588.name: Karrablast
588.description: It spits a liquid from its mouth to melt through Shelmet’s shell. Karrablast doesn’t eat the shell— it eats only the contents.

589.name: Escavalier
589.description: It charges its enemies, lances at the ready. An image of one of its duels is captured in a famous painting of Escavalier clashing with Sirfetch’d.

590.name: Foongus
590.description: The spores released from this Pokémon’s hands are highly poisonous, but when thoroughly dried, the spores can be used as stomach medicine.

591.name: Amoonguss
591.description: Amoonguss generally doesn’t move much. It tends to stand still near Poké Balls that have been dropped on the ground.

592.name: Frillish
592.description: Legend has it that the residents of a sunken ancient city changed into these Pokémon.

593.name: Jellicent
593.description: Whenever a full moon hangs in the night sky, schools of Jellicent gather near the surface of the sea, waiting for their prey to appear.

594.name: Alomomola
594.description: The reason it helps Pokémon in a weakened condition is that any Pokémon coming after them may also attack Alomomola.

595.name: Joltik
595.description: Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out static electricity. They’re often found sticking to Yamper’s hindquarters.

596.name: Galvantula
596.description: It lays traps of electrified threads near the nests of bird Pokémon, aiming to snare chicks that are not yet good at flying.

597.name: Ferroseed
597.description: Mossy caves are their preferred dwellings. Enzymes contained in mosses help Ferroseed’s spikes grow big and strong.

598.name: Ferrothorn
598.description: Its spikes are harder than steel. This Pokémon crawls across rock walls by stabbing the spikes on its feelers into the stone.

599.name: Klink
599.description: It’s suspected that Klink were the inspiration behind ancient people’s invention of the first gears.

600.name: Klang
600.description: Many companies in the Galar region choose Klang as their logo. This Pokémon is considered the symbol of industrial technology.

601.name: Klinklang
601.description: The three gears that compose this Pokémon spin at high speed. Its new spiked gear isn’t a living creature.

602.name: Tynamo
602.description: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.

603.name: Eelektrik
603.description: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

604.name: Eelektross
604.description: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

605.name: Elgyem
605.description: This Pokémon was discovered about 50 years ago. Its highly developed brain enables it to exert its psychic powers.

606.name: Beheeyem
606.description: Sometimes found drifting above wheat fields, this Pokémon can control the memories of its opponents.

607.name: Litwick
607.description: The younger the life this Pokémon absorbs, the brighter and eerier the flame on its head burns.

608.name: Lampent
608.description: It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp. Once it finds someone whose death is near, it will trail quietly after them.

609.name: Chandelure
609.description: In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of lights, funerals were a constant occurrence— or so it’s said.

610.name: Axew
610.description: They play with each other by knocking their large tusks together. Their tusks break sometimes, but they grow back so quickly that it isn’t a concern.

611.name: Fraxure
611.description: Its skin is as hard as a suit of armor. Fraxure’s favorite strategy is to tackle its opponents, stabbing them with its tusks at the same time.

612.name: Haxorus
612.description: While usually kindhearted, it can be terrifying if angered. Tusks that can slice through steel beams are how Haxorus deals with its adversaries.

613.name: Cubchoo
613.description: It sniffles before performing a move, using its frosty snot to provide an icy element to any move that needs it.

614.name: Beartic
614.description: It swims energetically through frigid seas. When it gets tired, it freezes the seawater with its breath so it can rest on the ice.

615.name: Cryogonal
615.description: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148 degrees Fahrenheit.

616.name: Shelmet
616.description: It has a strange physiology that responds to electricity. When together with Karrablast, Shelmet evolves for some reason.

617.name: Accelgor
617.description: Discarding its shell made it nimble. To keep itself from dehydrating, it wraps its body in bands of membrane.

618.name: Stunfisk
618.description: Its conspicuous lips lure prey in as it lies in wait in the mud. When prey gets close, Stunfisk clamps its jagged steel fins down on them.

619.name: Mienfoo
619.description: Though small, Mienfoo’s temperament is fierce. Any creature that approaches Mienfoo carelessly will be greeted with a flurry of graceful attacks.

620.name: Mienshao
620.description: Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this Pokémon can shatter massive boulders into tiny pieces.

621.name: Druddigon
621.description: Druddigon are vicious and cunning. They take up residence in nests dug out by other Pokémon, treating the stolen nests as their own lairs.

622.name: Golett
622.description: This Pokémon was created from clay. It received orders from its master many thousands of years ago, and it still follows those orders to this day.

623.name: Golurk
623.description: There’s a theory that inside Golurk is a perpetual motion machine that produces limitless energy, but this belief hasn’t been proven.

624.name: Pawniard
624.description: A pack of these Pokémon forms to serve a Bisharp boss. Each Pawniard trains diligently, dreaming of one day taking the lead.

625.name: Bisharp
625.description: Violent conflicts erupt between Bisharp and Fraxure over places where sharpening stones can be found.

626.name: Bouffalant
626.description: These Pokémon live in herds of about 20 individuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will lose the hair on their heads for some reason.

627.name: Rufflet
627.description: A combative Pokémon, it’s ready to pick a fight with anyone. It has talons that can crush hard berries.

628.name: Braviary
628.description: Because this Pokémon is hotheaded and belligerent, it’s Corviknight that’s taken the role of transportation in Galar.

629.name: Vullaby
629.description: Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too small for older Vullaby to wear often get passed down to younger ones in the nest.

630.name: Mandibuzz
630.description: They adorn themselves with bones. There seem to be fashion trends among them, as different bones come into and fall out of popularity.

631.name: Heatmor
631.description: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour their insides.

632.name: Durant
632.description: With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can crunch their way through rock. They work together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.

633.name: Deino
633.description: Because it can’t see, this Pokémon is constantly biting at everything it touches, trying to keep track of its surroundings.

634.name: Zweilous
634.description: Their two heads will fight each other over a single piece of food. Zweilous are covered in scars even without battling others.

635.name: Hydreigon
635.description: The three heads take turns sinking their teeth into the opponent. Their attacks won’t slow until their target goes down.

636.name: Larvesta
636.description: Larvesta’s body is warm all over. It spouts fire from the tips of its horns to intimidate predators and scare prey.

637.name: Volcarona
637.description: This Pokémon emerges from a cocoon formed of raging flames. Ancient murals depict Volcarona as a deity of fire.

638.name: Cobalion
638.description: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.

639.name: Terrakion
639.description: Spoken of in legend, this Pokémon used its phenomenal power to destroy a castle in its effort to protect Pokémon.

640.name: Virizion
640.description: Legends say this Pokémon confounded opponents with its swift movements.

641.name: Tornadus
641.description: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.

642.name: Thundurus
642.description: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.

643.name: Reshiram
643.description: According to myth, if people ignore truth and let themselves become consumed by greed, Reshiram will arrive to burn their kingdoms down.

644.name: Zekrom
644.description: Mythology tells us that if people lose the righteousness in their hearts, their kingdoms will be razed by Zekrom’s lightning.

645.name: Landorus
645.description: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.

646.name: Kyurem
646.description: The sameness of Zekrom’s and Kyurem’s genes allowed Kyurem to absorb Zekrom. Kyurem can now use the power of both electricity and ice.

647.name: Keldeo
647.description: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

648.name: Meloetta
648.description: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

649.name: Genesect
649.description: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

650.name: Chespin
650.description: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn’t faze it.

651.name: Quilladin
651.description: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won’t start fights.

652.name: Chesnaught
652.description: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.

653.name: Fennekin
653.description: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

654.name: Braixen
654.description: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

655.name: Delphox
655.description: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.

656.name: Froakie
656.description: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

657.name: Frogadier
657.description: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute’s time.

658.name: Greninja
658.description: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

659.name: Bunnelby
659.description: It’s very sensitive to danger. The sound of Corviknight’s flapping will have Bunnelby digging a hole to hide underground in moments.

660.name: Diggersby
660.description: The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally well. People used to make heavy winter clothing from fur shed by this Pokémon.

661.name: Fletchling
661.description: When this Pokémon gets excited, its body temperature increases sharply. If you touch a Fletchling with bare hands, you might get burned.

662.name: Fletchinder
662.description: Fletchinder are exceedingly territorial and aggressive. These Pokémon fight among themselves over feeding grounds.

663.name: Talonflame
663.description: Talonflame dives toward prey at speeds of up to 310 mph and assaults them with powerful kicks, giving the prey no chance to escape.

664.name: Scatterbug
664.description: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.

665.name: Spewpa
665.description: The beaks of bird Pokémon can’t begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.

666.name: Vivillon
666.description: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

667.name: Litleo
667.description: This hot-blooded Pokémon is filled with curiosity. When it gets angry or starts fighting, its short mane gets hot.

668.name: Pyroar
668.description: The temperature of its breath is over 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, but Pyroar doesn’t use it on its prey. This Pokémon prefers to eat raw meat.

669.name: Flabébé
669.description: Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s collected from its flower. The crown has hidden healing properties.

670.name: Floette
670.description: It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives anyone who messes up a flower bed.

671.name: Florges
671.description: Its life can span several hundred years. It’s said to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.

672.name: Skiddo
672.description: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn’t need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.

673.name: Gogoat
673.description: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.

674.name: Pancham
674.description: Wanting to make sure it’s taken seriously, Pancham’s always giving others a glare. But if it’s not focusing, it ends up smiling.

675.name: Pangoro
675.description: Using its leaf, Pangoro can predict the moves of its opponents. It strikes with punches that can turn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.

676.name: Furfrou
676.description: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

677.name: Espurr
677.description: There’s enough psychic power in Espurr to send a wrestler flying, but because this power can’t be controlled, Espurr finds it troublesome.

678.name: Meowstic
678.description: The defensive instinct of the males is strong. It’s when they’re protecting themselves or their partners that they unleash their full power.

679.name: Honedge
679.description: The blue eye on the sword’s handguard is the true body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it drains people’s lives away.

680.name: Doublade
680.description: The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly alternating between offense and defense to bring down their prey.

681.name: Aegislash (Shield)
681.description: Once upon a time, a king with an Aegislash reigned over the land. His Pokémon eventually drained him of life, and his kingdom fell with him.

682.name: Spritzee
682.description: The scent its body gives off enraptures those who smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of love for Spritzee.

683.name: Aromatisse
683.description: The scents Aromatisse can produce range from sweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells that sap an opponent’s will to fight.

684.name: Swirlix
684.description: The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes Swirlix’s fluffy fur. This Pokémon spits out sticky string to tangle up its enemies.

685.name: Slurpuff
685.description: Slurpuff’s fur contains a lot of air, making it soft to the touch and lighter than it looks.

686.name: Inkay
686.description: By exposing foes to the blinking of its luminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them, and then it seizes the chance to flee.

687.name: Malamar
687.description: It’s said that Malamar’s hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.

688.name: Binacle
688.description: If the two don’t work well together, both their offense and defense fall apart. Without good teamwork, they won’t survive.

689.name: Barbaracle
689.description: Having an eye on each palm allows it to keep watch in all directions. In a pinch, its limbs start to act on their own to ensure the enemy’s defeat.

690.name: Skrelp
690.description: Skrelp looks like a piece of rotten seaweed, so it can blend in with seaweed drifting on the ocean and avoid being detected by enemies.

691.name: Dragalge
691.description: Dragalge generates dragon energy by sticking the plume on its head out above the ocean’s surface and bathing it in sunlight.

692.name: Clauncher
692.description: By detonating gas that accumulates in its right claw, this Pokémon launches water like a bullet. This is how Clauncher defeats its enemies.

693.name: Clawitzer
693.description: Clawitzer’s right arm is a cannon that launches projectiles made of seawater. Shots from a Clawitzer’s cannon arm can sink a tanker.

694.name: Helioptile
694.description: The sun powers this Pokémon’s electricity generation. Interruption of that process stresses Helioptile to the point of weakness.

695.name: Heliolisk
695.description: One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.

696.name: Tyrunt
696.description: Tyrunt is spoiled and selfish. It may just be trying to frolic, but sometimes the ones it’s trying to frolic with are gravely injured.

697.name: Tyrantrum
697.description: Complete restoration is impossible, allowing room for theories that its entire body was once covered in a feather-like coat.

698.name: Amaura
698.description: Amaura was restored successfully, but it’s not expected to live long because of the heat of the current environment.

699.name: Aurorus
699.description: This usually quiet and kindly Pokémon has a surface temperature of around –240 degrees Fahrenheit.

700.name: Sylveon
700.description: There’s a Galarian fairy tale that describes a beautiful Sylveon vanquishing a dreadful dragon Pokémon.

701.name: Hawlucha
701.description: It always strikes a pose before going for its finishing move. Sometimes opponents take advantage of that time to counterattack.

702.name: Dedenne
702.description: Since Dedenne can’t generate much electricity on its own, it steals electricity from outlets or other electric Pokémon.

703.name: Carbink
703.description: To keep the jewels on their bodies free of tarnish, packs of Carbink use their soft manes to polish one another’s jewels.

704.name: Goomy
704.description: Their horns are powerful sensors. As soon as Goomy pick up any sign of enemies, they go into hiding. This is how they’ve survived.

705.name: Sliggoo
705.description: The lump on its back contains its tiny brain. It thinks only of food and escaping its enemies.

706.name: Goodra
706.description: Its form of offense is forcefully stretching out its horns. The strikes land 100 times harder than any blow from a heavyweight boxer.

707.name: Klefki
707.description: Klefki sucks in metal ions with the horn topping its head. It seems this Pokémon loves keys so much that its head needed to look like one, too.

708.name: Phantump
708.description: With a voice like a human child’s, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.

709.name: Trevenant
709.description: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon’s feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.

710.name: Pumpkaboo
710.description: The light that streams out from the holes in the pumpkin can hypnotize and control the people and Pokémon that see it.

711.name: Gourgeist
711.description: In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist will come knocking. Whoever answers the door will be swept off to the afterlife.

712.name: Bergmite
712.description: This Pokémon lives in areas of frigid cold. It secures itself to the back of an Avalugg by freezing its feet in place.

713.name: Avalugg
713.description: As Avalugg moves about during the day, the cracks in its body deepen. The Pokémon’s body returns to a pristine state overnight.

714.name: Noibat
714.description: No wavelength of sound is beyond Noibat’s ability to produce. The ultrasonic waves it generates can overcome much larger Pokémon.

715.name: Noivern
715.description: Flying through the darkness, it weakens enemies with ultrasonic waves that could crush stone. Its fangs finish the fight.

716.name: Xerneas
716.description: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.

717.name: Yveltal
717.description: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

718.name: Zygarde
718.description: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.

719.name: Diancie
719.description: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

720.name: Hoopa
720.description: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.

721.name: Volcanion
721.description: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

722.name: Rowlet
722.description: During the day, it builds up energy via photosynthesis. At night, it flies silently through the sky, on the prowl for prey.

723.name: Dartrix
723.description: It never slacks when it comes to the task of cleaning its feathers. Thorough preening keeps it looking spiffy and its blade quills nice and sharp.

724.name: Decidueye
724.description: In a tenth of a second, it can nock and fire an arrow quill, piercing an opponent’s weak point before they notice what’s happening.

725.name: Litten
725.description: Trying to pet Litten before it trusts you will result in a nasty scratch from its sharp claws. Be careful.

726.name: Torracat
726.description: When facing a powerful enemy, Torracat’s fighting spirit gets pumped up, and its fire bell blazes hotter.

727.name: Incineroar
727.description: Incineroar’s rough and aggressive behavior is its most notable trait, but the way it helps out small Pokémon shows that it has a kind side as well.

728.name: Popplio
728.description: If Popplio want to create big, powerful balloons, they must be persistent. It takes daily practice for these Pokémon to develop their skills.

729.name: Brionne
729.description: On nights when the sea is calm, Brionne dance with one another to the singing of the Primarina that’s leading them.

730.name: Primarina
730.description: For Primarina, every battle’s a stage. Its singing and the dancing of its balloons will mesmerize the audience.

731.name: Pikipek
731.description: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!

732.name: Trumbeak
732.description: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.

733.name: Toucannon
733.description: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.

734.name: Yungoos
734.description: Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh living things, so it marches down streets in search of prey.

735.name: Gumshoos
735.description: Patient by nature, this Pokémon loses control of itself and pounces when it spots its favorite meal—Rattata!

736.name: Grubbin
736.description: It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.

737.name: Charjabug
737.description: Its digestive processes convert the leaves it eats into electricity. An electric sac in its belly stores the electricity for later use.

738.name: Vikavolt
738.description: If it carries a Charjabug to use as a spare battery, a flying Vikavolt can rapidly fire high-powered beams of electricity.

739.name: Crabrawler
739.description: Crabrawler has been known to mistake Exeggutor for a coconut tree and climb it. The enraged Exeggutor shakes it off and stomps it.

740.name: Crabominable
740.description: Before it stops to think, it just starts pummeling. There are records of its turning back avalanches with a flurry of punches.

741.name: Oricorio
741.description: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.

742.name: Cutiefly
742.description: An opponent’s aura can tell Cutiefly what that opponent’s next move will be. Then Cutiefly can glide around the attack and strike back.

743.name: Ribombee
743.description: Ribombee absolutely hate getting wet or rained on. In the cloudy Galar region, they are very seldom seen.

744.name: Rockruff
744.description: This Pokémon intimidates opponents by striking the ground with the rocks on its neck. The moment an opponent flinches, Rockruff attacks.

745.name: Lycanroc
745.description: With swift movements, this Pokémon gradually backs its prey into a corner. Lycanroc’s fangs are always aimed toward opponents’ weak spots.

746.name: Wishiwashi
746.description: When it senses danger, its eyes tear up. The sparkle of its tears signals other Wishiwashi to gather.

747.name: Mareanie
747.description: Unlike their Alolan counterparts, the Mareanie of the Galar region have not yet figured out that the branches of Corsola are delicious.

748.name: Toxapex
748.description: Within the poison sac in its body is a poison so toxic that Pokémon as large as Wailord will still be suffering three days after it first takes effect.

749.name: Mudbray
749.description: It eats dirt to create mud and smears this mud all over its feet, giving them the grip needed to walk on rough terrain without slipping.

750.name: Mudsdale
750.description: Mudsdale has so much stamina that it could carry over 10 tons across the Galar region without rest or sleep.

751.name: Dewpider
751.description: Dewpider normally lives underwater. When it comes onto land in search of food, it takes water with it in the form of a bubble on its head.

752.name: Araquanid
752.description: It acts as a caretaker for Dewpider, putting them inside its bubble and letting them eat any leftover food.

753.name: Fomantis
753.description: During the day, Fomantis basks in sunlight and sleeps peacefully. It wakes and moves around at night.

754.name: Lurantis
754.description: The petals on this Pokémon’s arms are thin and super sharp, and they can fire laser beams if Lurantis gathers light first.

755.name: Morelull
755.description: Morelull live in forests that stay dark even during the day. They scatter flickering spores that put enemies to sleep.

756.name: Shiinotic
756.description: If you see a light deep in a forest at night, don’t go near. Shiinotic will make you fall fast asleep.

757.name: Salandit
757.description: This sneaky Pokémon will slink behind its prey and immobilize it with poisonous gas before the prey even realizes Salandit is there.

758.name: Salazzle
758.description: The winner of competitions between Salazzle is decided by which one has the most male Salandit with it.

759.name: Stufful
759.description: The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may be an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is flailing that can snap thick tree trunks.

760.name: Bewear
760.description: The moves it uses to take down its prey would make a martial artist jealous. It tucks subdued prey under its arms to carry them to its nest.

761.name: Bounsweet
761.description: When under attack, it secretes a sweet and delicious sweat. The scent only calls more enemies to it.

762.name: Steenee
762.description: Any Corvisquire that pecks at this Pokémon will be greeted with a smack from its sepals followed by a sharp kick.

763.name: Tsareena
763.description: A kick from the hardened tips of this Pokémon’s legs leaves a wound in the opponent’s body and soul that will never heal.

764.name: Comfey
764.description: These Pokémon smell very nice. All Comfey wear different flowers, so each of these Pokémon has its own individual scent.

765.name: Oranguru
765.description: It knows the forest inside and out. If it comes across a wounded Pokémon, Oranguru will gather medicinal herbs to treat it.

766.name: Passimian
766.description: Passimian live in groups of about 20, with each member performing an assigned role. Through cooperation, the group survives.

767.name: Wimpod
767.description: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy’s presence.

768.name: Golisopod
768.description: They live in sunken ships or in holes in the seabed. When Golisopod and Grapploct battle, the loser becomes the winner’s meal.

769.name: Sandygast
769.description: Sandygast mainly inhabits beaches. It takes control of anyone who puts their hand into its mouth, forcing them to make its body bigger.

770.name: Palossand
770.description: This Pokémon lives on beaches, but it hates water. Palossand can’t maintain its castle-like shape if it gets drenched by a heavy rain.

771.name: Pyukumuku
771.description: It’s covered in a slime that keeps its skin moist, allowing it to stay on land for days without drying up.

772.name: Type: Null
772.description: It was modeled after a mighty Pokémon of myth. The mask placed upon it limits its power in order to keep it under control.

773.name: Silvally
773.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

774.name: Minior
774.description: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.

775.name: Komala
775.description: It remains asleep from birth to death as a result of the sedative properties of the leaves that form its diet.

776.name: Turtonator
776.description: Eating sulfur in its volcanic habitat is what causes explosive compounds to develop in its shell. Its droppings are also dangerously explosive.

777.name: Togedemaru
777.description: When it’s in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.

778.name: Mimikyu
778.description: There was a scientist who peeked under Mimikyu’s old rag in the name of research. The scientist died of a mysterious disease.

779.name: Bruxish
779.description: Its skin is thick enough to fend off Mareanie’s spikes. With its robust teeth, Bruxish crunches up the spikes and eats them.

780.name: Drampa
780.description: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until it’s angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.

781.name: Dhelmise
781.description: After lowering its anchor, it waits for its prey. It catches large Wailord and drains their life-force.

782.name: Jangmo-o
782.description: Jangmo-o strikes its scales to communicate with others of its kind. Its scales are actually fur that’s become as hard as metal.

783.name: Hakamo-o
783.description: Before attacking its enemies, it clashes its scales together and roars. Its sharp claws shred the opposition.

784.name: Kommo-o
784.description: Certain ruins have paintings of ancient warriors wearing armor made of Kommo-o scales.

785.name: Tapu Koko
785.description: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.

786.name: Tapu Lele
786.description: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.

787.name: Tapu Bulu
787.description: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula’ula controls plants.

788.name: Tapu Fini
788.description: Although it’s called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.

789.name: Cosmog
789.description: Cosmog is very curious but not very cautious, often placing itself in danger. If things start to look dicey, it teleports away.

790.name: Cosmoem
790.description: It sucks in dust from the air at an astounding rate, frantically building up energy within its core as preparation for evolution.

791.name: Solgaleo
791.description: Solgaleo was once known as the Beast That Devours the Sun. Energy in the form of light radiates boundlessly from it.

792.name: Lunala
792.description: It steals the light from its surroundings and then becomes the full moon, showering its own light across the night sky.

793.name: Nihilego
793.description: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémon.

794.name: Buzzwole
794.description: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.

795.name: Pheromosa
795.description: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

796.name: Xurkitree
796.description: They’ve been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.

797.name: Celesteela
797.description: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

798.name: Kartana
798.description: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

799.name: Guzzlord
799.description: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry—it is certainly always devouring something.

800.name: Necrozma
800.description: When Necrozma latches on to Lunala, it becomes vicious, seeing enemies everywhere it looks. It will burn the world with lasers.

801.name: Magearna
801.description: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.

802.name: Marshadow
802.description: This Pokémon can conceal itself in any shadow, so it went undiscovered for a long time.

803.name: Poipole
803.description: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.

804.name: Naganadel
804.description: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.

805.name: Stakataka
805.description: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute’s true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.

806.name: Blacephalon
806.description: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents’ surprise to rob them of their vitality.

807.name: Zeraora
807.description: Electricity sparks from the pads on its limbs. Wherever Zeraora runs, lightning flashes and thunder echoes.

808.name: Meltan
808.description: They live as a group, but when the time comes, one strong Meltan will absorb all the others and evolve.

809.name: Melmetal
809.description: It can send electric beams streaking out from the hole in its belly. The beams’ tremendous energy can vaporize an opponent in one shot.

810.name: Grookey
810.description: It attacks with rapid beats of its stick. As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets more and more pumped.

811.name: Thwackey
811.description: When it’s drumming out rapid beats in battle, it gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won’t even notice that it’s already knocked out its opponent.

812.name: Rillaboom
812.description: The one with the best drumming techniques becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle disposition and values harmony among its group.

813.name: Scorbunny
813.description: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once it’s raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.

814.name: Raboot
814.description: It kicks berries right off the branches of trees and then juggles them with its feet, practicing its footwork.

815.name: Cinderace
815.description: It’s skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.

816.name: Sobble
816.description: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.

817.name: Drizzile
817.description: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it keeps enemies out of its territory by laying traps everywhere.

818.name: Inteleon
818.description: Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes’ weak points so it can precisely blast them with water that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.

819.name: Skwovet
819.description: It eats berries nonstop—a habit that has made it more resilient than it looks. It’ll show up on farms, searching for yet more berries.

820.name: Greedent
820.description: Common throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon has strong teeth and can chew through the toughest of berry shells.

821.name: Rookidee
821.description: Jumping nimbly about, this small-bodied Pokémon takes advantage of even the slightest opportunity to disorient larger opponents.

822.name: Corvisquire
822.description: The lessons of many harsh battles have taught it how to accurately judge an opponent’s strength.

823.name: Corviknight
823.description: With their great intellect and flying skills, these Pokémon very successfully act as the Galar region’s airborne taxi service.

824.name: Blipbug
824.description: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.

825.name: Dottler
825.description: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.

826.name: Orbeetle
826.description: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what’s around it—and what’s around it can include things over six miles away.

827.name: Nickit
827.description: Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.

828.name: Thievul
828.description: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. Boltund is its natural enemy.

829.name: Gossifleur
829.description: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.

830.name: Eldegoss
830.description: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.

831.name: Wooloo
831.description: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won’t be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.

832.name: Dubwool
832.description: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.

833.name: Chewtle
833.description: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémon bites down and never lets go.

834.name: Drednaw
834.description: This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and take them down.

835.name: Yamper
835.description: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.

836.name: Boltund
836.description: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.

837.name: Rolycoly
837.description: It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough, rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.

838.name: Carkol
838.description: By rapidly rolling its legs, it can travel at over 18 mph. The temperature of the flames it breathes exceeds 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

839.name: Coalossal
839.description: While it’s engaged in battle, its mountain of coal will burn bright red, sending off sparks that scorch the surrounding area.

840.name: Applin
840.description: As soon as it’s born, it burrows into an apple. Not only does the apple serve as its food source, but the flavor of the fruit determines its evolution.

841.name: Flapple
841.description: It flies on wings of apple skin and spits a powerful acid. It can also change its shape into that of an apple.

842.name: Appletun
842.description: Its body is covered in sweet nectar, and the skin on its back is especially yummy. Children used to have it as a snack.

843.name: Silicobra
843.description: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.

844.name: Sandaconda
844.description: Sand swirls around its body with such speed and power that it could pulverize a skyscraper.

845.name: Cramorant
845.description: This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.

846.name: Arrokuda
846.description: After it’s eaten its fill, its movements become extremely sluggish. That’s when Cramorant swallows it up.

847.name: Barraskewda
847.description: It spins its tail fins to propel itself, surging forward at speeds of over 100 knots before ramming prey and spearing into them.

848.name: Toxel
848.description: It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison to produce electricity. The voltage is weak, but it can cause a tingling paralysis.

849.name: Toxtricity
849.description: This short-tempered and aggressive Pokémon chugs stagnant water to absorb any toxins it might contain.

850.name: Sizzlipede
850.description: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they’re well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.

851.name: Centiskorch
851.description: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has large and very sharp fangs.

852.name: Clobbopus
852.description: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn’t alarmed when that happens—it knows they’ll grow back. It’s about as smart as a three-year-old.

853.name: Grapploct
853.description: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.

854.name: Sinistea
854.description: The teacup in which this Pokémon makes its home is a famous piece of antique tableware. Many forgeries are in circulation.

855.name: Polteageist
855.description: When angered, it launches tea from its body at the offender’s mouth. The tea causes strong chills if swallowed.

856.name: Hatenna
856.description: If this Pokémon senses a strong emotion, it will run away as fast as it can. It prefers areas without people.

857.name: Hattrem
857.description: Using the braids on its head, it pummels foes to get them to quiet down. One blow from those braids would knock out a professional boxer.

858.name: Hatterene
858.description: If you’re too loud around it, you risk being torn apart by the claws on its tentacle. This Pokémon is also known as the Forest Witch.

859.name: Impidimp
859.description: It sneaks into people’s homes, stealing things and feasting on the negative energy of the frustrated occupants.

860.name: Morgrem
860.description: With sly cunning, it tries to lure people into the woods. Some believe it to have the power to make crops grow.

861.name: Grimmsnarl
861.description: Its hairs work like muscle fibers. When its hairs unfurl, they latch on to opponents, ensnaring them as tentacles would.

862.name: Obstagoon
862.description: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.

863.name: Perrserker
863.description: After many battles, it evolved dangerous claws that come together to form daggers when extended.

864.name: Cursola
864.description: Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body surrounding its soul. You’ll become stiff as stone if you touch it.

865.name: Sirfetch'd
865.description: After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield, it strikes back with its sharp leek stalk. The leek stalk is both weapon and food.

866.name: Mr. Rime
866.description: Its amusing movements make it very popular. It releases its psychic power from the pattern on its belly.

867.name: Runerigus
867.description: Never touch its shadowlike body, or you’ll be shown the horrific memories behind the picture carved into it.

868.name: Milcery
868.description: This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.

869.name: Alcremie
869.description: When Alcremie is content, the cream it secretes from its hands becomes sweeter and richer.

870.name: Falinks
870.description: The six of them work together as one Pokémon. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change their formation as they fight.

871.name: Pincurchin
871.description: It stores electricity in each spine. Even if one gets broken off, it still continues to emit electricity for at least three hours.

872.name: Snom
872.description: It eats snow that piles up on the ground. The more snow it eats, the bigger and more impressive the spikes on its back grow.

873.name: Frosmoth
873.description: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.

874.name: Stonjourner
874.description: Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific time, they gather out of nowhere and form up in a circle.

875.name: Eiscue
875.description: This Pokémon keeps its heat-sensitive head cool with ice. It fishes for its food, dangling its single hair into the sea to lure in prey.

876.name: Indeedee
876.description: Through its horns, it can pick up on the emotions of creatures around it. Positive emotions are the source of its strength.

877.name: Morpeko
877.description: It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if they’re precious treasures. No matter how much it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.

878.name: Cufant
878.description: If a job requires serious strength, this Pokémon will excel at it. Its copper body tarnishes in the rain, turning a vibrant green color.

879.name: Copperajah
879.description: These Pokémon live in herds. Their trunks have incredible grip strength, strong enough to crush giant rocks into powder.

880.name: Dracozolt
880.description: The powerful muscles in its tail generate its electricity. Compared to its lower body, its upper half is entirely too small.

881.name: Arctozolt
881.description: This Pokémon lived on prehistoric seashores and was able to preserve food with the ice on its body. It went extinct because it moved so slowly.

882.name: Dracovish
882.description: Its mighty legs are capable of running at speeds exceeding 40 mph, but this Pokémon can’t breathe unless it’s underwater.

883.name: Arctovish
883.description: The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but breathing difficulties made this Pokémon go extinct anyway.

884.name: Duraludon
884.description: The special metal that composes its body is very light, so this Pokémon has considerable agility. It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.

885.name: Dreepy
885.description: If this weak Pokémon is by itself, a mere child could defeat it. But if Dreepy has friends to help it train, it can evolve and become much stronger.

886.name: Drakloak
886.description: Without a Dreepy to place on its head and care for, it gets so uneasy it’ll try to substitute any Pokémon it finds for the missing Dreepy.

887.name: Dragapult
887.description: Apparently the Dreepy inside Dragapult’s horns eagerly look forward to being launched out at Mach speeds.

888.name: Zacian
888.description: This Pokémon has slumbered for many years. Some say it’s Zamazenta’s elder sister—others say the two Pokémon are rivals.

889.name: Zamazenta
889.description: This Pokémon slept for aeons while in the form of a statue. It was asleep for so long, people forgot that it ever existed.

890.name: Eternatus
890.description: It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years ago. There seems to be a connection between this Pokémon and the Dynamax phenomenon.

891.name: Kubfu
891.description: If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from the depths of its belly.

892.name: Urshifu
892.description: This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in defeating foes by raining many blows down on them. Its strikes are nonstop, flowing like a river.

893.name: Zarude
893.description: This Zarude’s special strength stems from its love and care for an orphaned human child that the Pokémon has raised since the child’s infancy.

894.name: Regieleki
894.description: Its entire body is made up of a single organ that generates electrical energy. Regieleki is capable of creating all Galar's electricity.

895.name: Regidrago
895.description: Its body is composed of crystallized dragon energy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of every dragon Pokémon.

896.name: Glastrier
896.description: Glastrier has tremendous physical strength, and the mask of ice covering its face is 100 times harder than diamond.

897.name: Spectrier
897.description: As it dashes through the night, Spectrier absorbs the life-force of sleeping creatures. It craves silence and solitude.

898.name: Calyrex
898.description: Calyrex is known in legend as a king that ruled over Galar in ancient times. It has the power to cause hearts to mend and plants to spring forth.

899.name: Wyrdeer
899.description: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.

900.name: Kleavor
900.description: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokémon in the wilds, one's only recourse is to flee.

901.name: Ursaluna
901.description: I believe it was Hisui's swampy terrain that gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.

902.name: Basculegion
902.description: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui's rivers is Basculegion's equal.

903.name: Sneasler
903.description: Because of Sneasler's virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.

904.name: Overqwil
904.description: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname "sea fiend." It slurps up poison to nourish itself.

10004.name: Wormadam (Sandy)
10004.description: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.

10005.name: Wormadam (Trash)
10005.description: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.

10009.name: Rotom (Wash)
10009.description: With a body made of plasma, it can inhabit all sorts of machines. It loves to surprise others.

10010.name: Rotom (Frost)
10010.description: With a body made of plasma, it can inhabit all sorts of machines. It loves to surprise others.

10012.name: Rotom (Mow)
10012.description: With a body made of plasma, it can inhabit all sorts of machines. It loves to surprise others.

10014.name: Castform (Rainy)
10014.description: Its form changes depending on the weather. The rougher conditions get, the rougher Castform’s disposition!

10015.name: Castform (Snowy)
10015.description: Its form changes depending on the weather. The rougher conditions get, the rougher Castform’s disposition!

10016.name: Basculin
10016.description: Known for their violence, these Pokémon have the most fights with schools of red- striped Basculin.

10025.name: Meowstic
10025.description: The defensive instinct of the males is strong. It’s when they’re protecting themselves or their partners that they unleash their full power.

10026.name: Aegislash (Blade)
10026.description: Once upon a time, a king with an Aegislash reigned over the land. His Pokémon eventually drained him of life, and his kingdom fell with him.

10100.name: Alo Raichu
10100.description: This Pokémon rides on its tail while it uses its psychic powers to levitate. It attacks with star-shaped thunderbolts.

10103.name: Alo Vulpix
10103.description: If you observe its curly hairs through a microscope, you’ll see small ice particles springing up.

10106.name: Alo Dugtrio
10106.description: These Diglett triplets dig over 60 miles below sea level. No one knows what it’s like underground.

10108.name: Alo Persian
10108.description: This Pokémon is one tough opponent. Not only does it have formidable physical abilities, but it’s also not above fighting dirty.

10109.name: Alo Geodude
10109.description: Its stone head is imbued with electricity and magnetism. If you carelessly step on one, you’ll be in for a painful shock.

10112.name: Alo Grimer
10112.description: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won’t grow in its path.

10113.name: Alo Muk
10113.description: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.

10114.name: Alo Exeggutor
10114.description: When they work together, Exeggutor’s three heads can put out powerful psychic energy. Cloudy days make this Pokémon sluggish.

10115.name: Alo Marowak
10115.description: When this Pokémon evolved, the skull of its mother fused to it. Marowak’s temperament also turned vicious at the same time.

10116.name: Lycanroc (Midnight)
10116.description: With swift movements, this Pokémon gradually backs its prey into a corner. Lycanroc’s fangs are always aimed toward opponents’ weak spots.

10117.name: Lycanroc (Dusk)
10117.description: With swift movements, this Pokémon gradually backs its prey into a corner. Lycanroc’s fangs are always aimed toward opponents’ weak spots.

10118.name: Vivillon
10118.description: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

10122.name: Vivillon
10122.description: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

10125.name: Vivillon
10125.description: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

10126.name: Vivillon
10126.description: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

10127.name: Vivillon
10127.description: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

10128.name: Vivillon
10128.description: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

10129.name: Vivillon
10129.description: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

10132.name: Vivillon
10132.description: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

10133.name: Vivillon
10133.description: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

10137.name: Oricorio (Sensu)
10137.description: This Oricorio has sipped purple nectar. Some dancers use its graceful, elegant dancing as inspiration.

10138.name: Gal Rapidash
10138.description: The fastest runner becomes the leader, and it decides the herd’s pace and direction of travel.

10140.name: Alcremie
10140.description: When Alcremie is content, the cream it secretes from its hands becomes sweeter and richer.

10141.name: Oricorio (Pom-Pom)
10141.description: This Oricorio has drunk bright yellow nectar. When it sees someone looking glum, it will try to cheer them up with a dance.

10142.name: Oricorio (Pau)
10142.description: This Oricorio has sipped pink nectar. It gets so caught up in its dancing that it sometimes doesn’t hear its Trainer’s orders.

10144.name: Aipom
10144.description: It searches for prey from the tops of trees. When it spots its favorite food, Bounsweet, Aipom gets excited and pounces.

10262.name: Ambipom
10262.description: It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both of its tails around you and gives you a squeeze, that’s proof it really likes you.

10284.name: Beautifly
10284.description: Beautifly has a long mouth like a coiled needle, which is very convenient for collecting pollen from flowers. This Pokémon rides the spring winds as it flits around gathering pollen.

10285.name: Bibarel
10285.description: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.

10286.name: Bidoof
10286.description: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

10288.name: Buizel
10288.description: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.

10292.name: Cacturne
10292.description: If a traveler is going through a desert in the thick of night, Cacturne will follow in a ragtag group. The Pokémon are biding their time, waiting for the traveler to tire and become incapable of moving.

10295.name: Camerupt
10295.description: The humps on Camerupt’s back are formed by a transformation of its bones. They sometimes blast out molten magma. This Pokémon apparently erupts often when it is enraged.

10302.name: Combee
10302.description: It ceaselessly gathers nectar from sunrise to sundown, all for the sake of Vespiquen and the swarm.

10307.name: Cramorant (Gorging)
10307.description: This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.

10309.name: Croagunk
10309.description: Once diluted, its poison becomes medicinal. This Pokémon came into popularity after a pharmaceutical company chose it as a mascot.

10310.name: Gal Darmanitan
10310.description: When wounded, it stops moving. It goes as still as stone to meditate, sharpening its mind and spirit.

10313.name: Deerling
10313.description: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

10314.name: Deerling
10314.description: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

10315.name: Deerling
10315.description: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

10316.name: Donphan
10316.description: If Donphan were to tackle with its hard body, even a house could be destroyed. Using its massive strength, the Pokémon helps clear rock and mud slides that block mountain trails.

10319.name: Dustox
10319.description: When Dustox flaps its wings, a fine dust is scattered all over. This dust is actually a powerful poison that will even make a pro wrestler sick. This Pokémon searches for food using its antennae like radar.

10325.name: Finneon
10325.description: It lures in prey with its shining tail fins. It stays near the surface during the day and moves to the depths when night falls.

10331.name: Floatzel
10331.description: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.

10336.name: Florges
10336.description: Its life can span several hundred years. It’s said to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.

10340.name: Frillish
10340.description: Legend has it that the residents of a sunken ancient city changed into these Pokémon.

10350.name: Gabite
10350.description: It sheds its skin and gradually grows larger. Its scales can be ground into a powder and used as raw materials for traditional medicine.

10352.name: Garchomp
10352.description: Its fine scales don’t just reduce wind resistance—their sharp edges also cause injury to any opponent who attacks it.

10353.name: Gastrodon
10353.description: The softness of its body helps disperse the force of impacts, so although its body is uncommonly squishy, it’s also surprisingly resilient.

10359.name: Gible
10359.description: Its original home is an area much hotter than Alola. If you’re planning to live with one, your heating bill will soar.

10361.name: Gligar
10361.description: Gligar glides through the air without a sound as if it were sliding. This Pokémon hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then injects the prey with its poison barb.

10362.name: Golbat
10362.description: It attacks in a stealthy manner, without warning. Its sharp fangs are used to bite and to suck blood.

10365.name: Gulpin
10365.description: Most of Gulpin’s body is made up of its stomach—its heart and brain are very small in comparison. This Pokémon’s stomach contains special enzymes that dissolve anything.

10368.name: Heracross
10368.description: This Pokémon takes pride in its strength, which allows it to lift things 100 times heavier than itself with no trouble at all.

10369.name: Hippopotas
10369.description: This Pokémon is active during the day and passes the cold desert nights burrowed snugly into the sand.

10370.name: Hippowdon
10370.description: When roused to violence by its rage, it spews out the quantities of sand it has swallowed and whips up a sandstorm.

10372.name: Houndoom
10372.description: Identifiable by its eerie howls, people a long time ago thought it was the grim reaper and feared it.

10373.name: Indeedee (Female)
10373.description: Through its horns, it can pick up on the emotions of creatures around it. Positive emotions are the source of its strength.

10375.name: Jellicent
10375.description: Whenever a full moon hangs in the night sky, schools of Jellicent gather near the surface of the sea, waiting for their prey to appear.

10378.name: Kricketot
10378.description: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

10379.name: Kricketune
10379.description: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.

10381.name: Ledian
10381.description: It flies through the night sky, sprinkling sparkly dust. According to some, if that dust sticks to you, good things will happen to you.

10382.name: Ledyba
10382.description: These very cowardly Pokémon join together and use Reflect to protect their nest.

10384.name: Ludicolo
10384.description: If it hears festive music, it begins moving in rhythm in order to amplify its power.

10385.name: Lumineon
10385.description: They traverse the deep waters as if crawling over the seafloor. The fantastic lights of its fins shine like stars in the night sky.

10387.name: Luxio
10387.description: Upon encountering an opponent, this Pokémon prepares for battle by extending its claws, which can put out 1,000,000 volts of electricity.

10388.name: Luxray
10388.description: Seeing through solid objects uses up a lot of Luxray’s electricity, so the Pokémon sleeps for long periods of time to store up energy.

10391.name: Magikarp
10391.description: This weak and pathetic Pokémon gets easily pushed along rivers when there are strong currents.

10392.name: Mamoswine
10392.description: It looks strong, and that’s exactly what it is. As the weather grows colder, its ice tusks grow longer, thicker, and more impressive.

10396.name: Meditite
10396.description: Meditite heightens its inner energy through meditation. It survives on just one berry a day. Minimal eating is another aspect of this Pokémon’s training.

10404.name: Milotic
10404.description: It’s said that a glimpse of a Milotic and its beauty will calm any hostile emotions you’re feeling.

10408.name: Minior (Blue)
10408.description: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.

10409.name: Minior (Green)
10409.description: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.

10410.name: Minior (Indigo)
10410.description: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.

10412.name: Minior (Orange)
10412.description: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.

10413.name: Minior (Violet)
10413.description: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.

10414.name: Minior (Yellow)
10414.description: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.

10417.name: Gal Mr. Mime
10417.description: It’s known for its top-notch pantomime skills. It protects itself from all sorts of attacks by emitting auras from its fingers to create walls.

10466.name: Sawsbuck
10466.description: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.

10487.name: Silvally
10487.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

10488.name: Silvally
10488.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

10500.name: Gal Stunfisk
10500.description: Its conspicuous lips lure prey in as it lies in wait in the mud. When prey gets close, Stunfisk clamps its jagged steel fins down on them.

10541.name: Gal Weezing
10541.description: Long ago, during a time when droves of factories fouled the air with pollution, Weezing changed into this form for some reason.

10547.name: Gal Yamask
10547.description: The spirit of a person from a bygone age became this Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching for someone who knows its face.

86315.name: His Braviary
86315.description: Because this Pokémon is hotheaded and belligerent, it’s Corviknight that’s taken the role of transportation in Galar.

86319.name: His Zoroark
86319.description: With its disheveled white fur, it looks like an embodiment of death. Heedless of its own safety, Zoroark attacks its nemeses with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates Zoroark's own body.

86320.name: Basculegion
86320.description: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui's rivers is Basculegion's equal.

86321.name: His Voltorb
86321.description: An enigmatic Pokémon that happens to bear a resemblance to a Poké Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.

90003.name: Basculin
90003.description: Known for their violence, these Pokémon have the most fights with schools of red- striped Basculin.

100006.name: Sin Gliscor
100006.description: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

100007.name: Sin Ninetales
100007.description: While it will guide travelers who get lost on a snowy mountain down to the mountain’s base, it won’t forgive anyone who harms nature.

10465.name: Sawsbuck
10465.description: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.

86318.name: His Goodra
86318.description: Able to freely control the hardness of its metallic shell. It loathes solitude and is extremely clingy—it will fume and run riot if those dearest to it ever leave its side.
